4081: Visitors are so careless with what they leave behind! The oceans are full of rubbish and it's hurting the wildlife. Let's pick it up together!'
4083: Investors are wealthy, and the wealthy don't work— they have others work for them.
4084: He has weathered countless storms and steered many ships safely to harbour. Will his luck persist?
4085: Bitten by the travel bug, nothing and no one can stop her from traveling the world.
4086: A bright young journalist once determined to reveal truth, now struggling with the reality of his job.
4087: Your sister Hannah, into whose lap the family business has landed. She always longed to get away and become a writer, before all this happened.
4088: Keep family and friends close. They give us purpose, they guide us. Please take this to some like-minded friends of mine.'
4089: Potatoes are poisonous was the rumour at afternoon tea. I doubt it, but dreadful if true! Perhaps it's worth investigation?'
4090: ...then all proceeds to schedule- Oh, hello my young acquaintance. I presently have need of some dynamite, for a household project.'
4091: Earl Smedley is a danger to our poor vulnerable Queen! Twelve years ago he crushed my cat beneath his Landau. I have never forgotten.'
4092: "I noticed a ship pretending to be a trading ship, then attacking other ships. Someone has to take care of it before it can cause even more trouble. Would you be so kind?"
4093: "A pirate ship connected to my niece is in trouble. While I don't support what they do, most of them had everything taken away and they were forced down this path, just like she was. I simply cannot ignore family in need."
4094: A plot against our frail young monarch! The ship may seem proper, but do not let yourself be fooled. Kill the snake, and secure our Queen a surer destiny.'
4096: "Someone found the necklace I lost years ago, but now their ship sank. It was a gift from my brother when I was young. An old woman like myself can have a strong sentimental attachment to things bringing back good memories."
4097: Cousin Mary cut her visit short after seeing the feline predator enclosures! Maybe she ate something foul ...? Would you bring her home?'
4098: "I saw an unfortunate ship get destroyed by a mysterious ship earlier, it looked like it belonged to those Pyphoreans. Seeing these wreckages reminds me of the tragedy, could you remove them dear?"
4099: "A visiting ship forgot some cargo in my harbour. Would you be so kind to pick up and bring it to them my dear?"
4105: Let's play a game. A visitor ship will pass through the area soon. I will attack it, and you must defend it. I don't see you succeeding, but surprise me!
4106: Her Majesty commends you to those of us on the royal council. It can only serve to increase that trust then, for her to see us sail together, and presume I also trust you.'
4107: Some innocent merchants have had a bit of bother. Could you guide them to my harbour, where they will be quite safe?'
4108: Viscount Foxweasel has borne a grudge ever since I smothered him in manure at public school initiation. He plans to sink my exhibition of recent carvings. Can you ensure it arrives intact?'
4109: The Maya expedition was a success, but rough seas have deposited one of Her Majesty's treasures en route. She would be most indebted if you could recover it.'
4111: They are not traditionally a sailing nation you see, the hill-dwellers. Lost last time, and the time before that. Perhaps you can save us, and guide them in?'
4113: You know, the fools stole my least interesting sculptures! Still I'd rather such naive carvings weren't inflicted upon the general public!'
4114: "I am really bored, so I thought it would be fun to send one of my strongest ships into enemy waters and watch the show. I will hold you responsible if my ship somehow sinks. "
4116: "A ship sank in the area. I got a ship ready to bring the castaways to safety, just drop them in my harbour (Bring them to me, so I can send a ship for you to destroy)."
4124: The Duchess of Powys can be quite lemony with me, but perhaps you could whizz by and explain the jolly mix-up - vigilant times, the sinking of her barge, etc.'
4125: Her Majesty received an alarming missive over second breakfast. Threats to 'undermine' her authority. Perhaps you could bring the matter to a peaceful climax?'
4126: Shocking to hear rumours of dissidents nearby. Such a brazen threat to our inexperienced Queen. Play the patriot and stamp out the growing fire.'
4128: "VIP - Sightseeing Trip Around the world! Show him around will you"
4129:
Archie needs the players help to escort an expedition he is either about to send out, or that is returning.

The expedition was to gather new types of wood he heard awesome rumors about, in an attempt to find the ultimate carving wood.

However, jealous competitors got word of it too, they might want to sabotage. So the player gets asked to help out.
4130:
Hunt wants the player to escort a scientist who just made a "great discovery", the greatest discovery. Really. She will be able to save humanity.

She is afraid others might want to stop this or steal the knowledge/ideas, so asks for an escort just in case (do we spawn attackers?)

Maybe royale attackers? Or is this too direct?

She portrays the mission as "for the good of humanity", can't imagine anyone wanting to interfere - then there are a lot of attackers, makes the player wonder if intentions are good.
4131: I believe in slow penance for wrongdoers - counting grain, for example. You see, if even small crimes go unpunished, one's whole world may go to seed.'

9541: "While Jean and I have a very different approach, we share a goal in which we face a common enemy. If he does well, it benefits the movement as well."
9542: I have three ships ready to set out and help the people from a recently liberated piece of land. La Corona did not even provide them enough food or good clothes. I cannot wait to take action against these animals, but we have to be patient.
9543: The enemy is using the latest technology, and we have to adapt if we want to keep up. We have been offered engineering help, but we lack the required materials.
9544: La Corona are way out of line torturing and killing local people. Even though we can't openly act, they have to be stopped, I can't bare seeing this.
9545: I have reports coming in of a group of colonial war ships entering the region. I don't know what they are up to, but last time we did not act, things got nasty. I learned the hard way that in these situations its either them or us.
9546: George Smith, a man I deeply respect for his actions, recently helped us out by sending a scout ship. He successfully identified La Corona were delivering weapons. Please make sure his efforts are not in vain.
9547: I am very much against it, but I am afraid not giving in to the current request to take action against an La Corona ship visiting us, will cause internal conflict or even a division. One united movement will be required to win this battle.
9548: Bente Jorgensen has her heart in the right place. She came here to help as soon as she heard of the situation. However, the poor thing has no idea what she is getting herself into. I don't want her to get involved.
9549: The empire has been helping us out in secret. Another ship with supplies will soon arrive again, but La Corona have stepped up their presence in the area. I am afraid it will not reach us.
9550: Bad reputation. Parties located here are not friendly with you.
9551: Good reputation. Parties located here are friendly with you.
9552: An important, secret weapon delivery got disturbed by an inspection. The ones helping us were forced to drop the cargo overboard to not get into trouble themselves. Luckily I got word of the location.
9553: What is happening here in the region bothers me, more than you can imagine. But engaging in a battle we cannot yet win is not the way to go. These members of the movement tried and failed.
9554: I heard disturbing news from my family. They are in need of medical supplies which they are not getting. I have some ready, including a letter for them, and arranged a good friend who is willing to head there, but she cannot be seen near my harbour.
9555: Sometimes these waters can catch ships by surprise. In this case, I saw a Corona ship get wrecked. I want to have the wreckages of the ship analyzed to understand what we are currently up against.
9556: La Corona complicate everything. These pigs think they own everything, even the region's waters. Just the other day they halted my shipment of trading supplies, and took it all. I arranged the next shipment to be dropped at a designated map point, so this won't happen again.

9562: Your father's trinket may not have much material value, but I sense there's more to it than that.
9563: The Editor is impressed about the great composition of the photo.

9566: Through these lenses the future manifests...first in darkness; an angry spark - then riots of flame!

9674: I heard you are going to set on your first expedition soon! How exciting! I am also preparing an expedition actually, and I need some timber to have the damage on my ship repaired. I can't risk sending out a damaged ship with so many lives on board.
9675: I am glad to see you are doing so well! That ship should really help you. Right now you could use it to perform a good deed. I noticed a ship lose cargo just now, go and help them!
9676: Even though you faced some rejection, don't feel down! You just have to stay positive and keep trying. What always helps me cheer up is helping others, maybe it works for you too. You could help out the orphanage!
9677: So your father knew Isabel Sarmento too? I really look up to her and how she does everything she can to fight for the rights of the people. I prepared a ship to help, and I want to make sure it leaves safely.
9678: All this talk about social status. Although my advisors might care about these things, nothing changes for me, I always liked you. In fact, why don't we go for some sailing together, right now?
9704: All this talk about social status and what it means. Do you know what it really means? Absolutely nothing, all humans are useless creatures. I will let you experience how it means nothing first hand. I marked two ships of owners of different social status.
9705: They turned you down, so what. You know, screw them, when I feel down, blowing things up makes me usually feel better. Why not get back at them while you are at it? Sink one of their deliveries, that should hurt them.
9706: Isabel Sarmento huh, I don't care too much about what she wants and all that, but anyone fighting those Corona pigs gets my support. I have some unfinished business with them, so I will send a ship her way.
9733: So now you got a ship huh? I bet you couldn't even deliver wood to my harbour. I heard some rumors of how useless you are, and I am starting to think they might be true.
9734: Oh? So you really managed to do something right. It still doesn't prove much, though. You will need to do a lot more to earn the respect of people like myself. You can start by bringing me some more materials.
9735: I am not surprised people don't want to deal with you, you have no reputation to prove yourself after all. You should be thankful I am willing to give you work. Speaking of which, go pick up a delivery for me.
9736: The New World seems to be the talk of the day. I am sending a ship there too, and see what sort of beneficial deals I can get out of the locals. But some ex-trading partners of mine have been annoying me, so you are responsible for the safety of my ship.
9739: The strength of the movement will only increase as we expand our territory. I have my eyes set on certain pieces of land, belonging to private owners. I will need a good amount of gold to compensate them.
9744: La Corona started rapidly construction a huge bridge. This bridge means they have a much stronger position, preventing it is our top priority. I already noticed several ships carrying materials, those are easy targets.
9745: I sent out a ship to gather information on La Corona and what their next move might be. I got word the ship returned with crucial information, and we can't afford to have it travel unguarded.
9746: We managed to get these children away from La Corona. My harbor has been a safe haven for them, but they are still in the middle of conflict. They will travel to a safer place with this ship, and I want to ensure their safe leave.
9748: Oh, you've been preparing for an expedition? How exciting! In fact, I'm itching to set out again, but my ships need urgent repairs. Help a fellow pioneer in need?
9749: The faster we're done, the sooner we can set out!
9752: Thank you, fellow traveler! I'll steer clear of coral reefs this time.
9754: Society is unforgiving with what to do and not do ... but it is most unforgiving to the poor and orphaned. Us oddballs can still help!
9755: Don't let the sneering get you down!
9756: The children are overjoyed! People are wrong about you.
9758: It must be wonderful to be back on a ship! Now you can help people out even better - I heard a trader lost cargo just close to you!
9759: A ship is indispensable when helping people!
9760: You should have seen the look on the trader's face!
9762: So you've heard of Isabel, the dreamy rebel leader? I so want to support her, can you escort my ship of supplies to her?
9764: I'm sure this will bring the movement closer to victory!
9766: My advisors finally came around to you, proclaiming things about standing ... but I've always liked you! Do you want to escape the fuss on a sailing trip?
9767: I just told my advisors I'd step out for some fresh air!
9768: And we didn't even need any standing for a lovely trip!
9770: Where did you get a ship?! You look more like a deck-scrubber to me. Or can you disprove society rumours you're a worthless parasite?
9771: A ship, how?! The least you can do is serve me with it.
9772: Amazing, you delivered wood. We're all so proud of you and your ship.
9773: The rumour is true, you have no use.
9774: Independent Isabel makes exploitation of her people so hard, there must be something I can get them hooked on...
9775: Sarmento's Movement must be prone to vice, get to it!
9776: They drown in schnapps, and I in money!
9778: Surprised they reject you? A squit with not a gnat's cummerbund of reputability? Here's the sort of menial labour you were born to do...
9780: Down on your shins and thank me.
9781: That's the last time I bother rejecting you!
9782: Finally risen up to sour the cream of decent society? Look after my rich friends, or I'll ensure you never live it down.
9783: Standing notwithstanding, you have it all to prove.
9784: Licking boots won't get you up the ladder, you know.
9785: Society belches violently in your direction.
9786: Isabel Sarmento is a simpering wisp. She needs fattening up if she is to play scapegoat on feast day. The day La Corona are massacred.
9787: Isabel has need of our indulgence...
9788: The turkey is plump, soon the feast can begin!
9789: Perhaps you want to be sacrificed instead?
9790: Proud of your standing, ehh, but what does it mean? A poor ship, an aristocrat ship. Destroy both, then come tell me how it help the aristocrats, ehh?
9791: Show me, poor or rich, that they are equal in death.
9792: Wolves are free from the leash to kill as they please.
9793: Perhaps I can appreciate standing... on your tongue.
9794: Rejection is your prison, but destruction the key to freedom. Realise violence, and imagine it is them you destroy.
9796: Yes. Life is rejection, so reject life.
9797: You have a sordid fetish for rejection.
9801: Pearls, I love threading them. However, my current supplier was acting up, so I told him that he is no longer needed. I want to show him my words have meaning, and that he truly is instantly replaceable.
9802: Maintaining social contacts and status is very important, something you will learn at some point. For this reason I don't want to disappoint an old client, although I don't do these things myself anymore.
9803: Suhail Salim Rostamina, a Sheikh with great power and influence is visiting the region. We did some business before, but I want to further invest and refresh his memory. Make sure to mention Madame Kahina sent you!
9804: I couldn't explain you why exactly, but an eerie feeling has been bothering me ever since this morning. I can't help but feel something bad is about to happen.
9805: Looks like I have run out of Champagne. Don't you sometimes wonder how things would look if you made a different decision somewhere in the past? It's so fascinating how decisions result in chains of irreversible consequences.
9806: Customers repeatedly ask me for these Pocket Watches. I don't exactly find them exotic, but seems that I might be able to make good money with them. I would like to try a sample batch.
9807: My next shipment will not be here for a while, and some of my stocks completely depleted. It would be foolish not to take money when I have the possibility to do so.
9808: An old friend in need reached out to me. He made a huge mistake; told the client it was done without confirming himself. Turns out the target is alive and well, here in the Old World. If the client finds out it could cost him his live.
9809: Under normal circumstances I would just feel sorry for these sad, petty criminals. but they decided to steal from one of my shipments this time around. If I would be dealing with it myself, I would cut off their hands.
9810: I recognized a ship as being part of the organization that once betrayed me. Its presence in the region might be a complete coincidence, but it might have come to track me down, a risk I am not willing to take.
9811: One could argue killing people is never a good thing, but I would say they are wrong. The jobs I took helped the world get rid of some terrible people. But this local assassin is only in it for the money, taking every job.
9812: Years ago I made a mistake and took a job I should not have. It left the wife and children of my target in a bad position. From time to time, I arrange an anonymous delivery for them, containing things they might need. It soothes me knowing they do well.
9813: You show up just at the right time. Perhaps a bit boring, but I have a small job for you. One crate of this client's purchase was accidentally left behind by the ship picking it up. I do miss the thrill of my old life in my moments like these.
9814: Someone I used to know is running from authorities. She needed to get rid of a few pieces of evidence, and notified me where she left them. I am afraid I have to provide them to the authorities, she should have been more careful.
9815: This client requested their purchase to be delivered to their ship rather than coming to pick them up. While small requests like these annoy me, take my word for it when I tell you the importance of gaining people's respect and keeping them close.
9816: I have always been a role-model citizen, so there is nothing to compensate for, but from time to time, I donate things I can miss so they end up with those needing them.
9817: Friends from back home are paying me a visit. These are the type of people at the very top of society, used to nothing but the best. They surely expect a proper escort.
9818: The side effect of providing exotic high-value wares is that it has the tendency to attract certain buyers. The kind that feels too important to travel without escort.
9819: I have a very expensive shipment coming in soon. The value is likely beyond what you can imagine. Point is, it is the kind of shipment one does not allow to travel unguarded.
9820: This lord claims he no longer purchases from me because he is too afraid of pirates to send his ships into the region. An excuse of course, but I knew how to deal with it. I offered him an escort, and guess who is buying again.

9914: I'll come down on you like a tonne of bricks' he used to say. Well let's see who has the last laugh, now we're all grown up eh?!'
9915: Alfred and Filbert are a lovely pair of shillings. Now, I couldn't remember if it were ten tonne or twenty owed. But being gents, they were quick to remind me it was thirty.'
9916: My latest trick is called 'The Devil's Vessel' a fearful extravaganza of sea-fire! Got a bit hot the first time...'specially for the crew, but its getting there, getting there...'
9917: A pocket watch I can guess your card,' is how the trick starts. Shame the cards they keep choosing are the hardest ones to find.'
9918: Asking for gold, I was sure it was the ghost, come for his due. Luckily it's only a brigand, and he gave his word it'd just be this once!'
9919: Lord Flattenflee and I had such a cultured chat, I think he loaded up one too many crates! Haha. I've got loads more, course...but I do need those materials.
9920: I get through quite a few stage assistants...I mean, you know, they leave. Can't take the city lights, the glamour. P'haps if they looked the part, they'd feel the part?'
9921: Woe is me! Jove and Juno converge upon me! Chandeliers above the audience was a genius idea!...as mum always said try and try again!'
9930: Why'd he have to shout out how its done?! Time that bully Astronomo got a huge kick up the interior - it's what mum wouldda done.'
9931: I'm caught between a frog and a toad! Board want off with a dangerous geezer. I'm like the David to his Goliath, but can I leave all that glory to you?'
9932: I may be amazingly powerful, but I'm hardly cruel. Take this darkness off me 'ands, you'll get a reward. Just don't tell the board, alright?'
9933: Whoopsiedaisies, some crates fell into the ocean when I was moving them on my docks. My mom would always tell me to keep things clean. I don't even recall what's in the boxes, so you can keep them for your efforts.
9934: Magic is truly underappreciated. Was just performing in front of the board during the trip, and out of the blue, one ofthem grabs my entire magic box and throws it overboard. He is lucky I am so calm and let it slide just like that.
9935: I was instructed to not look in these boxes, so I will respect their privacy. I just don't understand why the board wants me to store them, they have warehouses too. I also don't get this whole secret drop off thing, they could just bring them here.
9936: Heard of some boxes floating out in the ocean. I tell ya, never underestimate what one might leave floating around. Get them before someone else does, this is Willie's deserved little moment of luck after all this misfortune.
9937: GO AWAY! No no, not you, I was talking to the ghost. I heard one can order a ghost to leave. Salt tends to keep them away too. I ordered a few crates, and even personally secured the shipment, but the ghost threw them overboard!
9938: If you ever want to get business advice from me, I might consider it. Just got a wonderful discount on these goods with minor defects, the supplier just dropped the goods and notified me where, not sure why he didnt just bring them.
9939: You could learn from my networking skills. Met this lovely chap, big scar over his eye. He is so kind to offer and pick up the payment he accidentally forgot. He just needs an escort because he apparently has some enemies.
9940: I could swear I had it just a minute ago, where is my wand?! Good thing you are here, I refuse to travel alone without my wand, not as long as the ghost is out there.
9941: Let me tell you about The Amazing Willie. Helped the board without hesitation when they requested help. Problem is that Amazing Willie is now involved in this conflict, and the board won't help me. My ships get constantly attacked.
9942: I guess I should have read the contract more carefully before signing it. But you know what, I don't mind having to give my close trading partners a free escort with every purchase they make, they are quite lovely really.
9943: I feel it, he is coming for me, the ghost! I need your help getting back to my harbour. I know what I will do! I will head to the lower deck and think about how to work on my tricks while you be on the lookout for the ghost when he strikes.
9944: Last time my delivery of magic supplies got mysteriously attacked. Who would possibly want to do that? I perform for everyone I know, frequently, without them having to even ask or pay for it!

10058: A former trading partner dared to betray Beryl by spying on her and threatening her street network. He tried to beat information out of some of the children and sold the information to her enemies. Now she wants you to respond by destroying the betrayers ships.
10059: Beryl wants to teach the player about her business and wants him to practice the most useful method to put pressure on a trading partner. She wanted to trade bread (or whatever) but her partner already had enough and declined her offer. She asks you to destroy one of his bread deliveries to raise his demand for bread again
10060: Another trading partner tried to trick Beryl by sending her low quality material. They thinned gunpowder with some fake powder, but she managed to look through it. Now she asks you to bring them their 'payment'.
10061:
Beryl mentions an inspector just visited her by surprise and got to see some things he should not have seen. It is of high importance this information does not get out.

I will absolutely not go to prison.
10062: They say piracy is in decline, and sadly, this is true. Unfortunate for local pirates like Anne, and even more unfortunate for their business partners like me. Parties like Lady Vistash, hired to hunt pirates, don't help the case. It is about time to fight back.
10063: Trust is the cornerstone of business relations. Lord Malkov, regular buyer of mine, broke this very trust. Several crates disappeared from my warehouse during his latest visit. Needless to say, I have no interest in further dealing with Malkov, and punishment is at place.
10064: I have many enemies from whom I know what to expect, the problem is unexpected enemies. Just last week I helped out a friend who needed mines. Today one of my ships reported spotting a mine on its route. I want to make sure these are not the mines I provided.
10065: Yesterday the ship I was on, ran into an unexpected inspection. While my crew was standing there I took it into my own hands to throw the crates of illegal goods overboard. I dodged the inspection, but I do need those goods, my buyers are waiting for them.
10066: Good money can be earned by dealing in smuggled alcholic drinks with high tax rates, such as rum, geneva and brandy. However, there is always a risk involved when selling them again. I received an unusually large order, which has my senses tingling,  and I am afraid of walking into an ambush.
10067: It is important to realize when someone you believe to be an ally, is your enemy. Bottom line: I am putting someone in my network who I don't trust to the test. I mentioned the route my ship full of riches will travel. If it gets attacked, I know enough, and you can interfere.
10068: Beryl wants to store her money somewhere safe and asks you to escort it out of the area. She does not trust the local bank.
10069: Beryl invited some of her friends to play cards and talk about business that they owe her. She wants you to "escort" them and to make sure that they aren't followed.

10521:
Dear Governor Bleakworth,

More of the traitor Samuel’s conspirators. Crimes and sentences as follows;

Ernest Sterling – Use of foul language – 16 years with hard labour.
Verity Goodheart – Impersonation – Transportation to the Antipodes.
Elias Noble – Writing a threatening letter – Life imprisonment
Honora Decent – Character assassination – Life imprisonment
The judge saw very well my view, that any lack of proof they conspired with a traitor was, in itself, evidence they hide something. All things considered, his verdict could have been far worse. While I am under no obligation to explain such details, I thought that as a fellow dispenser of justice, the facts of the case may be of interest to you.

Sincerely
Edvard Goode
(Edvard) Goode & Sons Ltd.

10614: The last abode of the forgotten Andes empire. Powerful spirits dwell in these ruins.
10615: The intricate carvings on this residence reveal previously unknown details of the stunning architecture of the Lost Cities.
10616: A former jade and turquoise trading sea port, Tulum was once a thriving landmark of the Lost Cities.
10617: Also known as the Temple of the Great Jaguar, this breathtaking sacred place used in rituals and sacrifices was considered a gate to Xibalba, the underworld.
10618: The advanced writing system of the Lost Cities continues to baffle researchers to this day.
10619: The king of the carnivores, the sight of its breathtaking skeleton alone is enough to leave the bravest man in complete awe.
10620: Researchers still debate if the characteristic triangular plates laid flat on its back, as a giant tortoise, of if they in fact ran vertically along its spine.
10621: One of the most colossal creatures to ever wander the Earth, the sheer size of this towering herbivore has physiologists puzzled as to how they could hold up their own weight.
10622: Even its discoverers struggled to believe that such a gargantuan sea creature once roamed the oceans cassually snacking on sharks.
10623: These very early paintings of bisons in charcoal and ochre are in such an exquisite state of conservation some skeptics have labelled the discovery as fraud.
10624: The depiction of the first hunts of our ancestors.
10625: The last remnants of the legendary temple, walking amid the awe-inspiring columns truly transports one to Aegean times.
10626: The best preserved of the major monuments of the Aegean Golden Age, the breathtaking majesty of this temple seems to reach out for a long forgotten deity.
10627: These remnants are imbued with an otherworldly energy. Stories suggest the sanctuary was erected atop a Ferrous Age place of worship.
10628: The last vestiges of the once beating heart of the Eagle Empire, these remnants belong to one of the many wings annexed by a long running chain of glorious emperors.
10629: The intricate design of this mosaic depicts an epic battle scene between Eagle Empire armies against their Parthian enemies.
10630: The exquisite tesellation remains almost untouched. Contemplating its concentric pattern makes one feel as lightheaded as spending an evening with Dionysus.
10631: Nobody to this day has understood the true significance or purpose of this giant megalithical monument, but a mystical, celestial energy resonates between its crown-arranged menhirs.
10632: The bewildering structure seems to signal a burial place where purifying funeral rituals took place.
10633: The Altar of the legendary Northen temple, where nine males of every living creatures were offered to the gods as sacrifices to stop famine and war.
10634: These intricate interlace patterns carved in stone were one of the most iconic trademarks of the Goidelic culture.
10635: A regular copy of the collection of stories about the medieval customs of the Old World.
10636: It wasn't worth much in its time, but retains some historical value.
10637: Not an uncommon stone, but dazzling all the same.
10638: The dent on its temple hints at the fate of its original owner.
10639: Its bearer was not high-born, but this shield withstood every fatal blow to protect them.
10640: Although many parts are missing, anthropologists believe it represents an old heathen deity.
10641: Rust has nearly eaten the whole of the blade by now.
10642: The vast treasure the leader of the corsairs hoarded throught his many years in the piracy business.
10643: Claims about its authenticity are flimsy, but if it is what it is said to be…
10644: An extraordinarily large, flawless piece, its glare is otherworldly.
10645: This lavish armour piece bathed in gold and engraved with war scenes is said to have belonged to a remarkable general.
10646: The researchers that stumbled upon these egg fossils initially misstook them for those of a giant bird.
10647: This ring made up of a solid piece of 22 carat gold was specially tailored for an ancient queen's hand.
10648: Whomever wielded this blade made sure it stated their status having its guard embroidered with noble filigrees and stones.
10649: The mythical treasure of the generous Goidelic ruler, legends say when drawn by a worthy person, the entire blade would blaze with fire.
10650: This treatise verses on the Art of Medicine, specifically anatomy and phisiology.
10651: The lower classes would live their whole life without ever catching a glimpse of their golden glimmer.
10653: The pinnacle of early Goidelic metalworking, its gilt silver filigrees weave the captivating swirling motifs characteristic of the Goidelic culture.
10654: The fossilised spiral shells of a long-lost species of marine molluscs.
10656: Some quality protection for those who went to war.
10657: The godlike proportions of the Aegean deity were finely sculpted in Parian marble.
10658: Elementary weapon that could resist a pair of battles.
10659: Enough to buy some slaves in the past time.
10660: The colors are still vivid thanks to the dry environment.
10661: More like a useless ornament than a protection.
10662: The pendant did not very well survive to the time.
10663: Corroded due to the humid environment in which it was let.
10664: and, as the hero brandished his sword toward the sun…'
10665: Rather let it down than take it in combat.
10666: Must have been nice hundreds of years ago.
10667: Can be dangerous for unshielded warriors.

Hannah is sure the island she purchased has an iron deposit site, although it looked hard to reach. She wants you to locate the iron deposit sites on the island, so a plan can be established.

10900: Hannah can hardly believe you would delay examining your father’s diary.

10911: He admits it is not clear how your father is involved in this matter.

Since the diary also states that your father did not unlawfully sell the New World island Prosperity, Hannah wants you to bring the diary to Sir Archibald Blake immediately. This it might reverse the Queen's accusations of treason towards your father.

10926: By following the lead of Thomas Ticker, Aarhant found that your father’s murderer was hiding in a cave westwards. Aarhant wants you to attack the murderer’s ship and confront him, in an attempt to reveal the truth and what really happened to your father. Aarhant stresses that you not let the murderer get away!
10927: Aarhant urges you to attack the ship.
10928: Aarhant presses you to act quickly if you are to avenge your father.
10931: Sir Archibald Blake explained that the New World island Prosperity was sold to a rebel movement leader named Isabel Sarmento. However, since the deal was signed, Isabel has been in hiding. To get to the core of your father's accusation, you will need to find Isabel Sarmento in the New World. Hannah is excited to go on this expedition.
10932: Hannah wants you to carefully plan the expedition to find Isabel Sarmento.
10934: Hannah hopes Isabel will be worth the effort it took to find her.

10954: Use propaganda to replace undesired articles

10961: Only people with high self-opinion can answer these extremely impossible questions...
10963: Man rides half-broken boneshaker over massive cobbles, what happens next will combust your mind!
10965: Juicy praying mantis knocked from top by one you won't believe! Number nine is a killer!
10967: He is if he keeps these five things in his garden shed...and five ways they can help restore the former fidelity of your marriage.
10969: Everybody is talking about the most distracting story in years, What she did next will leave you doubled-up...
10970: YOU ARE HAPPIER THAN YOU THINK
10971: Swing a pendulum before your eyes, repeating "I am happy." You will immediately feel a positive change within, or you should keep doing it until you do.
10973: Just remember, living itself is a good outcome! Typhus, typhoid, influenza, cholera, smallpox, yellow fever, malaria, scurvy - the list is endless.
10975: You are lucky! Depravity and peculiarity lie beyond your borders! Unspeakable conditions, indescribable unpleasantnesses! Blissful ignorance is your cheeriest friend!
10977: Angel Florence Nightjar only wishes that all could be as humble and gracious as the people of [Game Profile Info Name], people like you.
10979: As a citizen of [Game Profile Info Name], you have qualified for the final gyration of the tombola! To claim your prize, enclose fee for your entry ticket below...
10981: Is that who you would associate with? You are better than that! The so-called radicals are nothing more than thieves and opportunitists looking for an excuse for pillage!
10983: Only the weak-minded give in to populism! Stay in your homes, keep yourselves to yourselves, or you may soon face a run-in with the indomitable men in blue!
10985: There is no hiding in numbers! In the case of revolt, anyone and everyone on the list shall be subject to the maximum penalty of Her Majesty's law!
10986: DIM ENOUGH TO OPEN THIS BOX?
10987: Only an ignoramus forgets what befell poor Pandora! Inform the authorities of anyone who would believe anything else.
10989: Isolate, name and shame them. These upstart delinquents are nothing alone and broken, away from their flock.
10991: Stop consuming! Set aside your acquisitiveness, your materialism, and learn to nourish your spirit!
10993: Repent your greed! St. Peter's pearly gates are not half as wide as you imagine!
10995: Look at this picture, this is you! Get thee now to church and discover your inner puritan!
10997: Disease is everywhere. Everything we touch spreads illness, therefore touch as few commodities as possible!
10999: Rationing is for our greater good, and without a greater good, what good are you?
11001: Glory awaits you, brave young soldier! Your lust for adventure, your proud family behind you, and your enemy who want sticking on your bayonet.
11003: Your cause is just, your blade is true, and your spirit as keen as the fabled Marie D'Artois!
11005: If our enemies try to run once our suite of aces is turned, it'll be time to go "all-in".
11007: Our rivals have everything to fear, for we are Poseidon God of the Sea, brandishing mighty trident!
11009: Burnished boots and shining steel, our immaculate soldiery will slice through our dim-wit enemies like putty!
11011: Progress to unlock this propaganda article
11012: Her Majesty wants the following amount in taxes: [Queen ParticipantData Taxes CurrentTaxes]
11083: Lady Faithful desperately hopes you can help bring her husband back; Sir John Faithful and his expedition have gone missing somewhere in the Arctic. Your first step will be to head north with your own expedition.

11098: Lady Faithful is grateful you did everything you possibly could.
11099: Lady Faithful regrets you weren’t the help she thought you’d be.

11101: Lady Faithful believes every preparation vital, if the cold and inhospitable north is to be conquered.

11121: Lady Franklin has an important task.

11126: A detailed map of this area will help future expeditions.
11127: Lady Franklin has an important task.
11130: Lady Faithful’s hirelings already prove useful in search for husband’s lost expedition!
11132: Royal fleet’s pathetic search for lost expedition begs question, does the Queen even care?
11134: Lady Faithful’s hirelings build icebreaker! Path to rescue opens!
11136: Royal fleet’s pathetic search for lost expedition begs question, does the young Queen care?
11138: Rescue mission is back and crew of HMS Hades alive.
11140: Expedition found Mammut in ice for the museum.
11142: You don't have Trade Rights with
11144: Provides public service to your residents.
11148: Switch between [AssetData(2473) Text], [AssetData(2471) Text] and [AssetData(2476) Text] by clicking the trade options button in the top left.
11163: Crew members has been resuced by player.

11171: WIP Text: This is the description text of the arctic event character.
11185: Farmers flock to join [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], hoping to prosper from the earth as they always have done. At least at first, there will be little time for naps behind the haystack as the new settlement begins to find its feet...
11187: First Engineers bring discovery to the city! Books, telescopes and chemicals under their arms, they arrive in uniformed rows, peering over spectacles at their new habitat. Their welcome rationality is sure to trigger a sharp upturn in efficiency and advancement.
11189: First Investors arrive! Umbrellas tap on the pavement and capacious top hats devour hatstands – the elite are finally here! The markets are expected to see major growth in the coming weeks, with share prices already soaring. For a list of potential investments, see finance pp. 14-17.
11191: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] settles first island! Hopes abound that this seed will germinate into a great leafy tree, boughs heavy with golden fruit! In historic edition, we profile company pioneer, and enjoy the positivity – who knows if we shall see its like again!
11193: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] settles first island in the new world. Sticky financial climate at first, but refreshing cloudbursts forecast! Previously uninhabited island to act as initial HQ for overseas business in waters hitherto uncharted!
11196: Worthy trade boat leaves [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] ready for maiden voyage! Capacious hold asking to be filled to brim with riches, which naturally will be shared among loyal populace!
11198: Proud new warship [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] on first patrol! Brave crew wished luck by loved ones, and revelling in the romance of not knowing if they'll ever come back!
11200: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] spawns armada! To what purpose we can only hazard a guess, but whether for naval victory or merchant profit, a larger fleet must always be better!
11202: Income is no longer in the negative for [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] according to financial analysis. "We're headed back in the right direction at least!" concedes backer, forced to come down off high horse.
11204: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] bounces back from bankruptcy! Accounts no longer overdrawn! "A miraculous turnaround!" prate fickle and useless advisors that likely precipitated the crisis in the first place.
11206: Fire guts part of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], locals rage at failure of local authority to act. A few more buckets of water for example, and there may have been something salvaged from the blaze.
11208: Fire died out of its own accord in [Newspaper SelectedNewspaper Article([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. There is relief mingled with inquiry as to why the conflagration was allowed to take hold in first place.
11210: Firemen do their service proud in [Newspaper SelectedNewspaper Article([RefGuid]) Context TownName], let us never take their sacrifice for granted. "It was only a small fire," says brave fire chief, "I'll tackle worse 'ere the day I die."
11212: Singular heroics smother any chance of further fire in [Newspaper SelectedNewspaper Article([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as local authorities act swiftly and decisively to snuff out the blaze.
11214: Inferno utterly guts [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], "the city is damned!" croaks broken local, who like many others, has seen their life story disappear in towering columns of smoke.
11216: Emergency procedure saves [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] from complete incineration by recent inferno! Authorities praised for their handling of the situation, which many believed was beyond hope of rescue!
11218: Authorities take blame for inaction in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] as riot leaves city in tatters. What was at first regarded as a storm in a teacup, has now resulted in a burned lap!
11220: Riot in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] ends. Administration fortunate that concerns of populous have subsided naturally, but for how long will the lid remain on the simmering pot?
11222: Riotous spasm is easily quelled in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], local governor expresses relief that deterrents are working. Authorities put radicals back in their place, see pp. 3-5 for full account of how supremacy was achieved.
11224: Dedicated riot measures prevent further spread of dangerous ideology in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Authorities praised for containing leftist protests with ruthless precision!
11226: Any relief that the ugly great revolt has ended is overshadowed by doubt of whether damaged city will ever be the same again. This is not a matter of a few smashed windows, there is widespread damage for the city to contend with, not to mention lingering bad feeling.
11228: Crowds of delinquent demonstrators convinced to leave the streets of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] by well-prepared local authorities. An air of calm is said to have been essential in keeping the deep line of ruffians at bay. Full report pp 2-7.
11230: Special government intervention rescues [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] from the unshakeable madness of revolution! Town treated for especially virulent strain of radicals, whom the authorities deftly managed to isolate!
11232: Illness in [Newspaper SelectedNewspaper Article([RefGuid]) Context TownName] abates, but leaves affected districts drained of life. "I feel a ghost of my former self" moans figure still swaddled in bedsheet.
11234: Disease in [Newspaper SelectedNewspaper Article([RefGuid]) Context TownName] abates before it becomes more serious— thank heavens. Locals ascribe recovery to angels watching over them, and having escaped criticism, the prayers of the authorities must have been answered too!
11236: Success, as special measures are taken to curb further infection in [Newspaper SelectedNewspaper Article([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. "We are lucky a cure for this sickness has already been discovered!" says grateful convalescent.
11238: Epidemic ends, but leaves [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] in state of decay. "There are still crosses on the doors, and inside… it's medieval," laments stretcher-bearer.
11240: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] returns to full health once more, as residents declare [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] patron saint of the sick and infirm!
11242: Special measures ensure [Newspaper SelectedNewspaper Article([RefGuid]) Context TownName] epidemic is neutralised at its epicentre, a triumph of modern medicine!
11244: World fair foundations complete! [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] ready for global prominence!
11246: Work has begun on the next stage of construction of the World Fair in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], and to great excitement! If crowds are gathering only to witness the construction, imagine how many will flock to its opening!
11248: Opening day of World Fair edges ever-closer in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] as significant chapter in the construction ends. Clear progress is being made, and it is all very exciting.
11250: Magnificent monument in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] "firmly on track" to have ribbon cut on expected date, remarks building's architect, "great things take time, we had expected that."
11252: Significant delays plague [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] in the construction of its World Fair. People of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] grumble it is pork barrel politics, amid fears city may be overreaching.
11254: Desperate concern for World's Fair complex in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] after construction is unexpectedly halted. Many already calling the project a white elephant—goodness knows what they shall make of the venture now.
11256: World Fair opens in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] is proud new owner of the venue, achieving a feat we would never have imagined at the start of this extraordinary century!
11258: Celebration of architecture opens to visitors at World Fair in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Neo-classicist, Gothic, Romanesque—muse upon the themes of the age, behold all variety of decor-ornamentation, be inspired! Plan of the show floor p.17.
11260: Scientific extravaganza opens to public in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! World Fair presents its most novel exhibition; a bizarre futurescape; vast displays of mechanical apparatus, the brainchildren of the world's foremost innovators!
11262: The past comes to life in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Bewildering paleoethnoanthroarcheologistic discoveries see light of day after centuries dormant! Open the cabinet of curiosity! Drawer after drawer of meticulously-categorised finds!
11264: As delicious architectural pageant closes in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], designers and planners everywhere wax poetic over the event—"A triumph of modern collaborations", "a treasure trove for planners", "Civic inspiration!"
11266: Though miraculous exhibition of science has sadly ended in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], every visitor left positively charged! All agreed their eyes had been opened to the remarkable possibilities that lie ahead of us!
11268: As celebrated archaeological exhibition closes in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], visitors chime in agreement over its success. To have gained so much, both in spirit and tangibly from the past, has helped us understand our place in time better than ever.
11270: An expedition is officially underway, after months poring over maps and gathering the necessary expertise! Magnificent crew have spring in step according to the Captain, let us hope their enthusiasm will help them prevail!
11272: Expedition achieves the unthinkable, as crew surmount innumerable obstacles and reach their goal! "It is the longest tale, a fable of the sea… of monsters real, and imagined, of—" the proud Captain began, before we cut him off. A great crowd was present to cheer them home.
11274: Expedition goes terribly awry! Despair as expedition ship returns in bits, its crew mad and mutinous! Perhaps it is better we do not know what took place aboard the fateful voyage, for we could never fully understand the horror of it all!
11290: Market bustles open in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] as the town sets out a stall. A place to receive tidings from far-flung cousins, to buy extravagances, and to speculate about the eligibility of that handsome young gentleman with the oriental velvet hat.
11292: New Cabaret kicks life into [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] with the pizzazz of its dimly lit stage. Bohemians gather to satirise the high and mighty, indulge in exotic sensory experiences, and tinkle haphazardly on the ivories long into the night.
11294: University chartered in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. But "progress is not guaranteed by degrees," the new vice chancellor was keen to educate us. "The reputation of an institution must be garnered over time. Please come back in two hundred years."
11296: Members Club swaggers into [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], but doors won't open for just anyone! Promise of cocktails and billiards; a hideaway from the dreary working classes. For a full explanation of club rules, fees (substantial), and dress code see p.27.
11298: Bank opens first accounts in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], lending the city reputation as a centre of investment. "We act as a pair of safe hands," says new manager, "people feel greatly reassured to give us all their money."
11300: New Fire Station bell rings in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as its heroes begin the quest to tame the fiery beast raging through the city! If fire should strike your dwelling or workplace, send your swiftest pigeon, and this brave brigade shall heed your call!
11302: Bright new Hospital operating in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Residents inoculated against the growing list of maladies humanity has to contend with! "We even wash the syringes twice a month!" a proud nurse informs us, setting a high standard for hygiene!
11304: Visitor Harbour opens in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], sure to bring tourists to these shores in droves! Hopefully now they need no longer fall into the deceptive gap between ship and pier! (see edition No. 236).
11306: Zoo intoxicates crowds in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] with animal aromas, exotic habitats, and eerie parallels with human society. Indeed my own journalistic colleagues remind me of woodlice, the way they curl into a ball whenever the editor stops by.
11308: Fascinating Museum in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] among first institutions to open eyes of public to wider world. Each room a treasure, a dusty page in the book of history.  Booms in tourism expected! (see pp. 5-7)
11310: Zoological Gardens extended in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] to the delight of animal-lovers. Speculation as to what majestic fowl or beast might rampage through the undergrowth and spring upon us next!
11312: Additional museum wing snipped open in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], revealing cavernous new exhibition spaces! If the collections are to be extended, surges in visitor numbers are likely to follow!
11314: Are you ready to receive the item and start the quest?
11316: On error occurred during savegame transfer (Error [Online FetchSavegameErrorCode])
11322: Oil Plant active in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. The draw of black gold has never been so strong (markets on pp 16-21). It seems this mysterious murky substance still has so much to give, better hope it never runs out!
11326: Oil Harbour built in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], so boats may glide freely in and out, independently of other marine traffic. "We no longer have to experience greasy potatoes!" grins happy local...
11328: Trade Union founded in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], to share manufacturing methods and wisdom, and form a natural extension of guildcraft for this marvellous new era of transparency and worker rights!
11330: Town Hall now presides in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] – a centre for town planning and urban development. After all, civil planners always make such impeccable choices! And have such good taste!
11332: New Harbourmaster's Office in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] to steady the ship! "Good organisation is everything for any port worth its salt," says new harbourmaster.
11334: Steam Shipyard for [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Pride swells in local hearts, for among all the boons that could bestow themselves upon the city, none shall tend so greatly to its growth and prosperity than the advent of steam ships!
11336: New Harbour Defences protect [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], damning any enemy who tries their luck. "We'll blow them to bits," says mustachioed commander, as he oversees delivery of first munitions from carriage drawn by no fewer than twelve sturdy mules!
11338: A Repair Crane has been erected in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], which we gather will serve the important task of putting damaged ships back together. A general practitioner, if you will, for sea-going craft.
11340: New Pier extends harbour in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], harbour increasing proportionally with trade! More ships mooring in our waters than ever before!
11342: New Fishery flaps into life in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] and residents are hooked. "Fishing is traditional," says recruit fisherman, as company trawls town for willing seafarers.
11344: New Framework Knitters in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] now providing sound, if basic clothing. "We don't have to skip about naked any more!" said one delighted resident. Fashions for more discerning ladies/gentlemen can be found on pp. 25-26.
11346: Brick Factory fires up in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] as the island builds toward the future. "I've always thought the third pig the most sensible," says the foreman. "Bricks can really make a great foundation."
11348: New Sailmaker unfurls in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], suggesting ships must soon follow. Company emblem to feature on finished sails as a symbol of the ingenuity of the peoples it represents.
11350: New Bakery rises up in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], leavening the mood on the island. The upper crust may adore the smell of saffron buns, pies and pastries, but it is the staple loaf without which the city cannot hope to bloom.
11352: New Workwear Factory in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Employees everywhere need no longer worry about mentioning the word trousers, as highly-durable one-piece overalls are worn-in! A perfect fit for those spending their days on their knees.
11354: New Weapons Factory has competition firmly in its sights! We ask those in the know if they are to be used on home soil, or to pour fuel on the fire of world conflict. Excitement at the possibility of war! Vice Admiral Horncastle's armament speech verbatim on pp. 3-5.
11356: New Brewery in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] brims with desire to quench town thirst. The barrels have been rolled out, the spigots yanked, and golden ale runs in rivulets over the cobblestone. At least we thought it was ale...
11358: New Window Factory in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] sure to be a smash. A stone's throw from the city centre, the factory will produce float glass – a miracle of modern glassmaking.
11360: New Cannery opens in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], delighting gourmands and bunker-dwellers alike. Inhabitants look forward to the metallic tang of lead solder intermingled with sardines as an alternative to hard tack on long sea voyages.
11362: New Pocket Watch Factory springs into life in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], and not a moment too soon. An anxious white rabbit said to be first in line as production ticks up to full speed.
11364: New Rum Distillery uncorked in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], following lengthy drum rolls. "Better than your average grog," say distillers hoping to expand the market beyond salty sailor-types, "and unlike the imperial stuff, ours is ethically sourced".
11366: New Chocolate Factory unwrapped in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], in the hopes that it will temper cravings for sticky cocoa. Connoisseurs converge on the city, curious about this very pleasurable bean-derived sweetmeat; the chocolate bar!
11368: New Bicycle Factory peddles Penny Farthings in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. Throw your velocipedes and boneshakers into the canal! A new era of high-wheeled transportation has dawned. (other Transport news on p.19)
11370: Reinforced Concrete Factory keeps [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] in the mix with rivals. The formula, said to be a combination of lime and other powdered aggregates, is a secret in-house blend. Let us hope our place in history can now be cemented…
11372: Flashy new Light Bulb Factory in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] displays its brilliance. "They're hot to the touch!" said one resident about the pear-shaped baubles, "especially when you try to snuff them out…"
11374: New Champagne Cellar fizzpops into [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] to eveyone's sudden surprise! But don't be alarmed, for this "devil's wine" is de facto divine – an elegance that celebrates how refined this city has become.
11376: Fur Trader slinks into [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], selling furs stripped from the most velvetine mustelids in the animal kingdom. Wrap yourself in the faddish, the extrinsic, the inexcusable! See more Contemporary Fashion on pp.24.
11378: New Cigar Factory lights up in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. The local fatcats delight in drooping said bouquets rakishly from corners of their mouths while they watch gleefully over the factory floor.
11380: Gramophone Factory spins to life in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. The citizens are enchanted by the miracle of recorded music, finally able to experience the lesser-known composers. Small dogs everywhere look inquiringly into cones, confused as to the origin of the sound…
11382: Advanced Weapon Factory in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] fires us to the bleeding edge of warfare. Like Zeus on Olympus, we prepare to throw thunder at our enemies – never has there been a better time for wanton violence!
11384: Jeweller's Workshop brings sparkle to [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], or at least, lends a nice ring to it. Long have we wanted necklaces, earrings and c., and now our special day has finally arrived! For a full catalogue of pieces and prices, see pp 12-14.
11386: Carriage Assembly rolls into [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], a mighty treat for motor enthusiasts! Investors not getting carried away; "Horses are out of the window, but let's see if this car business has legs."
11388: Hannah is glad you are managing to produce timber already.

12912: Wormways Prison— A first terrible night!
12913: My island, Prosperity, is sold. That is all I can puzzle of my arrest, and present circumstance, shackled between these cold grey walls. Tomorrow I resolve to make my case again to Mr. Bleakworth, who today so cruelly refused me a proper explanation. Now I must try to sleep, and can think of nothing but my poor Hannah, and the other, so far distant.
12914: Wormways Prison – Light through the bars.
12915:
With daybreak comes clarity. Prosperity was sold to the infamous rebel 'Sarmento' – and I must be the last to have heard of it! The Queen, the nation, is up in arms, that the jewel of the new world is lost!

The guards, from whom I heard all, thought me playing some trick! Yet it is I who am tricked; duped of my island by persons unknown! Although it can only be the same persons that came to me one ominous day, masked and embroidered with eldrich symbols. They pressed me towards a sale. But I shut the door hard I tell you, and bid them good-day!
12916: I have today begun the process of gathering evidence in my defence. Hannah was here, though they did not let her stay long. She gives me hope that a full and unmitigated pardon is possible. Years of loyalty count in my favour, but the very idea that I may have betrayed my Queen weighs heavily upon me. Even if the dark clouds of scandal pass, they may forever have damaged our family’s prospects.
12917: Wormways - A third night, and alas not the last.

The judge saw very well my view that any lack of proof that they conspired with a traitor was, in itself, evidence that they're hiding something. While I am under no obligation to explain such details, I thought that as a fellow dispenser of justice, the facts of the case may be of interest to you.

Sincerely,

13417: Build a productive planks production chain.
13418: Aarhant already saw many farmers smiling without any reason.

13421: Farms need fields. Once the farm placed, you need to select the building and pick the field option to place the fields along the main building.

13423: Artisan would like to meet the grand music composer.

13462: Hannah is certainly paranoid about fire, but her worries are not always unfounded. So many wooden huts can easily burn, hence it's safer to have a fire station around.
13463: Build a productive planks production chain.
13465: Prepare your settlement against city incidents: a fire station will prevent fires.
13466: City institutions, like fire stations, take a bit of time to build. Don't wait for a fire to start to build one, it could escalate quickly.
13467: Fire stations reduce the risk of fire in their reach. Also, fire chances increase for heavy factories and when houses are piled on each other.
13468: Fire stations also automatically extinguish fires. In case the fire rages, you can select your city institution and deploy extra units to face an inferno.
13481: Hannah suggests to improve your housing quality.

14306: A firm alliance between proud nations has been achieved! The new partnership is set to be of vast importance to the immediate, even long-term futures of both sides. The final deal was mooted and passed under the noses, and more importantly, pens of the diplomatic suits in record time—
14308: "The decision does not mean our ongoing relations need turn nasty," was the official statement on cancelled alliance with [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName], and "no reason" why "alliance wouldn't be possible again in the future."
14310: Key alliance breaks down! With former ally [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] providing no answers, officials left to speculate the reason they withdrew support. It is unclear how this disappointing news has been received at the highest level.
14312: A profitable new partnership with [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName]! Our correspondent furnishes us with the latest figures, and trumpets the immediate economic gains from the deal.
14314: Future plans do not include trade with [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName], if the rumours are to be believed. Who benefits the most from the decision? More perspective on the economic landscape on page 12!
14316: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] severs trade ties in shock for local business! What might have been a fruitful relationship comes to cruelly to an end, as partner reneges on promises. Sharp decline in economy forecasted with steep-looking graphs on page 4.
14318: Peace at last! [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] signs treaty! Ambassadors return from the negotiating table with olive branch, white doves rise to the skies, children skip gladly through meadows. The war is over! Let the colour return to our cheeks!
14320: A ceasefire has been agreed. Whether moved to act by the destruction, or the strategic value of a pause, matters not. Wounds can now be licked, the situation reappraised, and perhaps, peace may be contemplated. The leaders of forces on both sides are said to be content with the situation.
14322: "No," say Admirals as conflict resumes following a period of ceasefire. Navies muster, sailors polish their cannons, powder is poured from kegs as the parties re-enter the pugilist's ring for another round. When will this needless bloodshed cease?!
14325: The powers that be have elected to go to war! Recruitment has already begun, lives at stake to uphold our values, to preserve unity and order, to meet danger half-way with zealous alacrity. Time will tell if it is a choice founded on wisdom.
14327: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] declares war! Peace and humanity desert us, as Mephistophelian adversary rises from the depths to confront us! We can only trust in our bravest to fight back this nemesis, and drive ruination from our shores.
14329: An alliance has formed between two of our rivals. Speculation mounts as to what they may be up to. Of course, their intentions could be perfectly chivalrous, but while any doubt remains, speculation of the more ignoble variety shall no doubt stir in the pool.
14332: An alliance between our rivals has broken down. In the following days, rumour is likely to gather as to that which broke the spell between them. It is unknown for example, whether this development will be seen positively or negatively here. More to follow.
14334: New agreements reached among our neighbours this forenoon—more details in today's Foreign Diplomacy, Trade and Things You Should Care About But Won't column.
14336: A trade agreement between rival powers has been cancelled. It seems they no longer saw eye-to-eye on the subject. Whether the boom of this minor diplomatic eruption will reach our shores remains to be seen.
14338: A peace treaty between rivals overseas has finally been kissed with a seal. Perhaps this grand gesture can seed a future of peace and progress. Or perhaps such wimpish withdrawals are symptomatic of this too-liberal age!
14341: A truce has been established between our neighbours. Pious hearts, non-partisans, will be glad that for a time, the suffering does not have to continue. How long will empathy last? Hortense McGough remarks upon the situation from the place of amnesty.
14343: A ceasefire has ended between two of our neighbours, meaning that it cannot be long before the first shot rings out into the night, and their forces are on top of one another once again. Let us hope the same winds of war do not blow this way. Full report pages 31-37.
14346: Our neighbours have declared war on one another. An intercepted telegram confirmed the news, which many believe had been brewing for some time - now the line is crossed, the dam burst! No reason for us to react however - neutrals should dissemble and play dumb!
14348: Pirate nuisance returns, disproving reports they had been wiped out! Hidden coves making motley, pestilential denizens of the black flag hard to sniff out. Let us hope it is only a matter of time before these skeletons of the last century go under for good!
14350: Diplomatic relations with [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] have "deteriorated" recently, say disgruntled ambassadors, as "consequence of innate differences between us". We hope importance of maintaining good relations with neighbours is not being overlooked.
14352: Relations with [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] have improved recently, say jovial ambassadors! Glasses clinked, and trays of finely-wrought chocolate pralines did circulate, as improved standing with our counterparts called for celebration.
14354: Unhappiness can lead to riots. The police station is the only building that will help you restoring order.
14355: All animal farms require enclosures. You can build them by selecting the farm once placed. They need to be placed in the radius of the farm.
14357: Pollution from heavy industry reduces your employees happiness. You can check the pollution of your island in the attractiveness menu.
14358: You can already start the weapons production. That's essential to build military ships and buildings.
14359: It's better to prepare your defenses in case of attack. Military buildings can be placed at the coast to defend your harbor.
14362: Missing a certain fertility? Trade routes can easily be setup from this menu. This enables goods transportation between islands.
14363: Your workers houses are ready to be upgraded. If you do so, we will welcome a new social class in the city.
14364: Bente is the young heir to the Jorgensen Trust, a philanthropic venture of her late father's. She is an alarmingly friendly individual, caring for all around her. An intrepid traveller, she believes the world exists for all to delight in and explore! Naturally, she is friends with almost everyone...
14365: Princess Qing is a young and uncertain envoy of the Imperial East. Struggling to bring about the very different diplomatic wishes of Emperor and Empress here in a new and unfamiliar place, she takes her consolation in writing wistful poetry on the nature of home.
14366: Behind the bold swish of Willie's conjuror's cape lives a fragile mouse, desperate for the affection conferred upon him by his late mother. Above all, it is fear that grips him— of some unspeakable and ghoulish reprisal— for Willie seems to have acquired his great fortune suspiciously suddenly!
14367: George Smith was long ago, a slave. An explosion at the mine took his father, and deafened him. Finding freedom, George seized the chance to make something of his life, and has now apparently done it all. But don't let that fool you— he's not finished yet.
14368: Beryl O'Mara was a goodly soul once— back when she believed her meek shopkeeper husband would escape the debtor's prison. He didn't. Years later, and it is she running a street game, with the help of her many eyes and ears. She'll invite you in for tea, but don't get too cosy— that's a sawn-off under the floral tablecloth!
14369: Artur Gasparov is a self-proclaimed visionary, francophile, and pursuer of architectural perfection. Breaking from the mirror only to schmooze with the most important critics, Gasparov has little patience for others, or indeed, any empathy at all. As he huimself has said, 'every great city is ruined by its people.'
14370: Carl, is a repugnant industrialist fat-cat. Blaming his parents for allowing the once-great name of Von Malching to fade from view, he is ever desperate to rub up with the nobility, and of course, pile up the gold. His philosophy is— money equals reputation, so take, take and take some more!
14371: Alonso Graves is a man disturbed. A former soldier of empire, war transformed his soul forever. The disdain and misanthropy within him can only momentarily be silenced with the blood of his former masters. Believing himself now to be a god, he is intent on 'freeing' all he may from the shackles of human existence.
14372: Admiral Vicente Silva is an experienced, calculating and humourless conqueror. His noble upbringing, and education at the finest military academies has primed him for a life in power. A staunch traditionalist, his conviction is that the crumbling empire in whose service he profits, will prevail against a world in rebellion.
14373: Lady Margaret Hunt's influence cannot be overestimated. A member of the Royal Council, she is trusted by all, rarely seeking sympathy for what has unquestionably been a difficult life. After all, she was born a Harlow— a name now synonymous with treason...but then, that was all buried long ago.
14374: Anne Harlow is the vengeful leader of a forsaken band— the last hurrah of piracy. She was born into nobility, only to see her father Benjamin hung for speaking against the King. In exile, Anne's lust to destroy the crown and social order has only grown with the arrival of a new and vulnerable Queen.
14375: Jean La Fortune escaped a life of slavery to become the leader of a new and independent nation on the isle his people call High Mountain. But his people cannot hope to grow while the Empire refuses to recognise them. With few allies in society, it seems Jean has little choice but to fight.
14376: Hannah suggests to start exploring the world for exotic productions.
14377: With your first artisans in town, your city is now ready to build stronger ships to explore distant lands. If you can reach there, you'll be able to produce exotic, valuable goods to bring back to the Old World. An opportunity no company shall neglect.
14379: Send an [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] to the New World
14380: Day Dreamers: Host [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
14381: Hannah recommends to import goods from the New World for your artisans.
14382: The New World benefits from a tropical climate that enables the growth of many different plants. That's your chance to import exotic and expensive goods to Europe, which, with a higher education, will participate in the happiness and social rise of your artisans.
14383: High Society: Host [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

14387: Engineers can establish electricity networks that can empower your production buildings. If you dig oil from the oil fields and transport it by rail to your generators, not only will your engineers enjoy the night lights, but your production buildings will get a great boost of productivity.

14391: Hannah is eager to start investing into lucrative production.
14392: With electricity running through your settlement, your company is ready to become one of the major companies in the world. You can start the production of the luxurious pocket watches, and make sure to have a bank for your employees.

14396: Hannah suggests to start building the World Fair.
14397: Some of your engineers enriched themselves until reaching the highest tier of the society. They will never agree to work, but they would surely invest in worldwide events like the World Fair. It is time to start building a monument, and prepare for the festivities.
14399: Stocks for the Inauguration: Save [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] tons of [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
14400: Access for the Aristocracy: Reach [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]% supply of [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
14401: Hannah is eager to see your city as highest visited city in the world.
14402: The World Fair is ready. This immense building is the perfect place to organize somptuous exhibitions where the greatest minds in the world would bring and showcase their latest inventions, discoveries and constructions. If you can successfully organize an event, you may have access to the most attractive items for your cultural buildings, and become the most attractive city in the world.
