15818: The Queen wants to hand over the Transfer Authorisation for you to pick up Edvard.
15819: With these wheels on, your carts will barely notice any bothersome muddy potholes or loose cobblestones.
15820: Your transportations can now catch up with the industrial race thanks to these steam powered carts! Only a little more expensive to maintain, but very fancy indeed!
15821: Steam is old news! Electricity is the NEW new scientific revolution of the century! Implement Tilbury's line of electric carts and banish costly labour to the past!
15822: Iron Framings greartly reinforce your building's structures to reduce the risk of fire catching up, so you can catch a breather!
15823: Terrible infernos or ugly metal structures? You don't need to choose! These Cast-Iron Doric Columns will help prevent potential fires while still looking beautiful.
15824: You want a glowing city, only not from conflagrations? Our Iron-and-Glass Magical Fire-Proof Architecture will stop any fire demons in their tracks and shimmer like a heaven made of glass!
15825: Need something to call your workforce back to toil? With some extra care, this old bell should do the trick.
15826: Your workers have trouble remembering the end of lunch time? Stop the slackers' moans with this Iron Factory Bell and get them to work already!
15827: Thanks to the Oxford Electric Bell you can forget about shirkers forever! The still running clock will only require a power outlet to keep track of your workforce hours, ensuring they will not miss a single minute of their shift!
15828: Need power but there's no powerplant in sight? That is exactly what dynamos were invented for! Disclaimer: may occasionally combust.
15829: Generate stable electricity anywhere! Our Steam Turbines will safely and conveniently power up your buildings wherever they are, no connection to electricity towers required!
15830: Piersons annouces his latest invention: the Turbo Generator! Its innovative system of turbine stages guarantees the highest safety, efficiency and power supply the market has to offer!
15837: Your metallurgical industries need a boost? For only a little more damage to the environment, this calciner will improve the refining process.
15838: Your heavy industries will revere this furnace! An advanced smelting process that will make your produce much sturdier and your workers' lives much easier.
15839: Pricey molten processes are a thing of the past now thanks to the Bessamer converter, a furnace that will increase the scale and speed of your heavy industries' production like nothing ever before!
15840: Need extra help in your processing factories? For a small cost, a planer will make metal cutting faster and enhance production.
15841: Tired of wasting time on metal cutting? Upgrade your processing industries with a helical planer and speed up this annoying task!
15842: You've never seen a faster metal cutting machine! Implement The Cutting Edge now in your processing factories and let electricity do all the work!
15843: Put this millstone to work and lift that one from around your neck!
15844: This French Burrstone will pulverise all your grinding issues to a fine, delicate mist!
15845: The fantastic Grinding Machine Lieberman can grind anything and everything in a matter of seconds! The ultimate addition to your milling factories!
15846: Precise chemical processing calls for precise measuring equipment, like this mercury thermometer.
15847: Another ruined batch in your chemical processing factories? This advanced melting point apparatus will rid your clueless workforce of having to guess the temperature ever again.
15848: As far as temperature measuring tools go, no other matches the precision of the Thiele Tube. The frighteningly accurate system will ensure your chemical processing factories perform at frighteningly productive rates.
15849: If your wood production is see-sawing, see to it with this bow saw.
15850: Nothing brings two people together as sharing a two-man saw. Bonding while working works for all of the parts involved!
15851: Why do it by hand when the Vaughan Drag Saw can do it for you? Using nothing but electricity, this unbelievable automatic saw can cut five times faster than any hand saw!
15852: Set this trap and leave it overnight. Chances are you'll find something the next day. Then again, maybe you won't.
15853: Some might call it cruelty, we like to call it effective! No beast, big or small, can evade the toothy grip of this leghold trap, and your hunters don't need to move a muscle.
15854: Have a case of scrawny hares? Say goodbye to your hairy problems! This fur stretcher will immensely increase the fur surface of even the tiniest of prey!
15855: Woods taking up too much land? Keep your groves at bay with these secateurs.
15856: Want to increase your woods' efficiency, but reduce their area? You don't have to choose thanks to these convenient loppers.
15857: Introducing the Original Lowe! The most advanced pruning tool that can cut cleanly and with barely any effort thanks to its anvil system! Your woodlands have never been more efficient!
15858: Are your farms in need of some fresh air? This plough can give your soil a breather.
15859: This cast steel plough can multiply the toil of one farmer by four, so they have more time for sowing and tending to crops.
15860: Welcome to the 19th Century, when machines can do all the work for you! These steel seed drills sow your crops faster, more efficiently and probably better than any human being can.
15861: Wood ash might not be the most glamurous fertilizer out there, but still effectively reduces the required soil for your crops.
15862: Can't spare any more room for crops? These chemically developed fertilizers have been designed to extend your soil's potential to the full.
15863: Bony livestock? With these vitamins, your animals should be nice and round in no time.
15864: No one wants animals to die… At least, not ahead of time! Prevent sickly livestock from succumbing to disease with these antibiotics.
15865: Lost count of how many livestock assets you have lost to anthrax? This vaccine will ultimately get rid of the bug and protect animals, population and investments alike.
15866: You have no more space to leave your livestock strolling around? You can now cram them all up in these stables!
15867: Your livestock won't want to go anywhere else—nor will they be able to in these fully equipped barns!
15868: Still treating your livestock like living beings? You can leave that in the past and make sure they are productively fat and packed into the tiniest space possible thanks to these revolutionary feedlots!
15869: Can't stand the stench of your livestock farms? This will keep it covered and contained.
15870: Manage your livestock waste in a clean and sustainable way by burying everything under this cover. The peak of hygiene!
15871: As elegant as waste management gets, this straw-mixed compost shed will cover the stench of your animal farms, leaving behind only green meadows and fresh air.
15872: Your miners won't stop complaining? Add this freight elevator to lift their spirits.
15873: This steam-geared elevator that can lift up to ten tons in one go is the perfect addition to your mining industries.
15874: Simon's latest elevator will dramatically reshape your mining scene! Performing solely on electricity, it has no rival amidst neither man nor steam-fueled machinery of its kind.
15875: Easy to operate by even the dimmest miner, this medium-sized auger is a very useful addition to your quarries' equipment.
15876: Make a dent in your quarry industries with this steam-powered drill press that will easily bore through every kind of terrain.
15877: This drilling rig's powerful electric motor allows it to bore into the Earth's surface like no other machine ever created before.
15878: Is your cloth production fraying? Your weavers will be able to operate this mechanical loom even in their sleep!
15879: Weaving by hand belongs in the past! With the appropriate power source and correct human supervision, these power looms can weave faster than the best knitter!
15880: The speed of a machine, the care of a master crafter! Easy to adjust and powered by electricity, the Roberts Loom is the fastest, most reliable weaving machinery even conceived!
15881: Disarray reigns in your assembly factories? Put everything back in line with this steam-powered conveyor belt.
15882: Haven't you heard? The assembly line is the manufacturing process of the future! This one is powered by electricity and incredibly dynamic!
15883: The Industrial Revolution is here! With this entirely mechanised factory, you will set a new landmark for mass-production assembly factories!
15884: Is your gastronomy a little bland? This oven should spice up your cooking factories.
15885: Heat up your local cuisine with this fancy cast iron stove, fit for the needs of every delicious treat-making factory.
15886: Thermo-Electrical cooking made easier than ever with the all-electric Smith stove, the latest revolution in cuisine that will make every mouth water!
15887: Are your beverage industries stagnating? This brew kettle will make your concoction process all the more bearable.
15888: All you need to add a spark to your beverages is this steam-powered brewing machine! The shelves will soon be flooded!
15889: Get your drinks flowing with this electric pump! Its system will not only accelerate the process greatly, but improve the resulting quality as well!
15890: Lose sight of tiny beads and pieces no more using this magnifying glass.
15891: This precision monocular allows your watchmakers to see every tiny tooth and detail, making detailed crafting both painless and flawless.
15892: The most comfortable, precise and agile magnifying glass of all, specially fitted for the purpose of handling the smallest, most delicate of materials in watchmaking and jewelling.
15893: Use this net to comb the waters and watch as your buckets of fish simply multiply.
15894: Tired of waiting for fish to take the bait? Just set up this drift net and relax! You'll find a cornucopia of delicious seafood on your return.
15895: We all know the best bits stick to the bottom. Now you can scrape the oceans with the unbelievable power of the Bricksham Trawler, the only fishing net able to tow up to 50 tons of fish out from the ocean depths!

15915: O, for a draught of vintage! Give these vines a few days and it will be as if they'd always been growing there.

15921: Indulge your sweet tooth with these syrupy sugar saplings! Or plant them and get even more!

15923: If you need a smoke, these seeds should grow into average quality tobacco leaves.

15936: Having trouble waking up without caffeine? Bring your population back to life with these coffee beans.
15937: Having trouble waking up without caffeine? Export the fragrant, delicious pungency of these select coffee beans to put a toasted full stop on morning drowsiness.

16055: Obrero would like you to end police corruption.
16056: Obrero hopes you can reassure Jornaleros that they can take a break.

16062: Obrero would like you to sell her mother's necklace to help the poors.
16063: Obrero would like to have a picture of her revolutionary friends.
16064: Obrero wants to publish a picture of the island to encourage immigration.
16065: Obrero would like to show her country as progressist by taking pictures of women at work.
16067: Obrero would like to receive weapons to send her revolutionary friend under the yock of La Carona.
16068: Obrero wants to distribute bread to the poor.
16069: Jornalero wants alpaca wool to make blankets for those in need.
16070: Obrero would like you to build a museum on the island.
16071: Obrero wants a town hall for the people representative to govern.
16072: Obrero would like to have a machine used in a factory.
16073: Obrero wants to have a book exhibition in the museum.
16074: Obrero wishes you to build houses for the war refugees.
16075: There are rumours of a child striving to survive in the wilderness! People say a bear and a panther look after him, but those are no conditions to live in! Could you find him for me? I will take good care of the poor thing.
16076: A gang of horribly corrupter police officers are extorting the good people of this town and beating people up when they refuse to comply. They have threatened me too, but not speaking up against injustice is against my nature!
16077: The jornaleros at the corn field, they are so hard-working... Too much for their own good! They need to take their legally required break! They won't listen to us, but I know they'll listen to you.
16078: Help! My friends has been abducted by La Fortune's brutes! She must be somewhere on his island! Please, I beg of you, bring her back!
16079: The war has left many orphans behind... I am committed to doing as much good as I can in the world. If you see a child on the streets, will you send them to me? I will look after them.
16080: Gratitude is so often taken for granted... We have decided to give good when good is due. I know it's a small thing, but we wanted to celebrate everything you've done for us with a present.
16081: Our family gathers every week to have a lunch together, but and there's always so much food left over! I hate to see it all go to waste. Please, take it and share it with the ones in need.
16082: The bridge you have set between our continents is unprecedented! I have learned so much from your Old World, I would love to contribute to spread the knowledge about our culture there as well! Could you take this and set it on display?
16083: Nana Angustias passed away and left me her wedding necklace. But I don't need it, really. I know it's worth something, I'm sure you can put it to good use and help the less fortunate... I know it is what she would have wanted as well.
16084: Today marks the first year anniversary of the rise of our revolution. Your editor wants to feature us freedom fighters in a commemorative article, and since you have been such an inspiration for us it would mean a lot if you could take the snapshot.
16085: We are all so proud of all the exemplary improvements you have done here, as should you! Wouldn't it be perfect to celebrate this town with a feature article in your newspaper? It may encourage more people to emigrate to join us!
16086: Our society has come such a long way in the past few years! Now a woman can have her own income and independence without it being frowned upon. We obreras want to be an example for generations to come, could you showcase a picture of us humble factory workers in your newspaper?
16088: We are lucky enough to be living times of peace, but many of my comrades are still fighting against the grip of La Corona. They require weapons, but it would be too risky for you to smuggle them yourself. If you entrust me with the supplies, I could sent them to my comrades through our underground network!
16089: Many of our comrades are still fighting against La Corona, but their supplies are running low and hunger is starting to wear them down... If you can spare some bread, I can make sure it makes their way to them.
16090: Most can't imagine how cold nights can get in the open, even if it's warm in daylight. I will never forget the freezing nights when we were running from La Corona. If you can spare some alpaca wool, I can make blankets to send the refugees.
16091: It is a real shame that children here have to be home schooled. The experience of sharing knowledge is lost on us. If only we had a museum, we could turn it into a shrine of culture.
16092: We have fought long and hard to be rid of tyranny, now is the time for democracy! We need to elect our own representatives, and they can only work from a town hall.
16093: Oh could you use a machine in one of our factories? I would love to see modernity in the making!
16094: Ah, the classics of literature! I abhor the thought of people going about their whole lives without ever reading a page. We need to spark the love for the written word! How about a book exhibition?
16095: There are still so many war refugees knocking at our doors, Gobernor. If you were to house them, I am sure they would be more than happy to join our flourishing community!
16097: There is no future in wood cutting, if only I could learn about electricity instead!

16133:
Roses are red.

Violets are blue.

Onions stink.

And so do you.
16134:
My head is full of random stuff,

Like rusty bread and bits of fluff.

And talking pies with googly eyes,

And stupid stuff that doesn't rhyme.

16154: Great! That's the first animal of his experiment! Could you find his crocodiles now?
16155: Wonderful! Just need the baboon and we are all set!
16156: I just spoke to mister Darwin, he is thrilled to work with a patron so understanding as you. He agrees to move in the city!
16157: Mmh, I can send her my child but there is no way that I am feeding this useless mouth, she will have to take care of it as well!
16158: What a wonderful opportunity! I wished I had the same when I was a child.
16159: Leaning is the best way for my daughter to understand the pressure classes put on us and fight them effectively!
16160: I do need the money my daughter brings by going to the factory but if this allow her to do better than me in life ...
16161: Teaching to children? What a weird idea, mine learnt everything she had to know by living the real life!
16162: What is she? Some kind of Jean Valjean? Fair enough, let her take care of my son but she better not complain when he will do his usual shenanigans.
16163: Thank you! He loved the bank, he said he will visit it with friends of his soon!
16164: Seems we have no time to cook the fish, in part because we can't reach consensus on the best method. Perhaps you could bring some of the tinned stuff instead?
16166: Wood flammable? Hmmn, yes I suppose that is a safety risk, maybe I will invest elsewhere...
16167: You're right, I am stressed. And a holiday might keep the whole family quiet for a while...
16168: Involved in shady dealings you say? Then I owe you my thanks, and shall withdraw from the deal immediately!
16169: Oh no, I'm terribly sorry, we blew all of our family fortune on this holiday...
16170: With a fellow notorious for his disreputable business practices? Never!
16171: That sounds a lucrative proposition indeed! I shall accept forthwith!
16172: Mr Scrounge may seem miserly, but I am certain a candle of charity burns yet in his heart. I shall wish him greetings of the season as I would any other!
16173: Bah! Humbug! What reason has he for being so merry?! I am by far the richer, and yet I find that season abhorrent!
16174: Dashed sorry old chap, but I'm a royalist through and through!
16175: For some upstart business nonsense? Are you mad? I work for the Queen!
16176: Yes! I will join you. After all, I have always been royally undervalued here...
16177: A solid, industrious frame, but too ancient! No, this old family factory is a lost cause!
16178: Ugh! What tired and tumbledown features! I see no prospects here.
16179: Oh yes, wowzer! I think we've hit the jackpot. That factory looks ideally situated.
16180: Are you quite mad, sirrah? Who doesn't already have a gramophone?!
16181: I'm the one who needs to blow off steam! I don't need an engine to do it for me!
16182: Well no surprise in the end, but ever a winner. You know me well! Gold is the one thing I shall never tire of.
16183: Fine, they were happy with the delivery. You don't mind me saying I paid for these right?
16184: What did they say? No no don't tell me, I just hope she understands.

16195: This fisherwoman caught a seagull feasting on her hard work. She wants to put it in your custody.
16203: This farmer's pigs have escaped their pen and now roam the streets of your city! Help her catch them, they are all she has in the world!
16204: The farmer's husband has a record of disappearing and drinking himself to sleep in the streets. She's worried something bad might have happened to him.
16205: The farmer's son is a renouned scoundrel and she has lost track of him yet another time. She's worried he might be getting in trouble again and requested your help to find him.
16206: This farmer girl has troubles finding a suitable companion to match her colourful personality. She has requested you help her find a worthy suitor.
16207: This farmer is very close to her cow Antoinette. She is nowhere to be seen and her owner is worried sick. She has asked for your help to find her old friend.

16211: The farmer's animals have escaped and she seems to believe they somehow planned it. Find them around town, they are all they have!
16213: The farmer really wants to see the alpacas of the New World. You can take a picture of them and send it her way! She will surely be grateful.
16214: The most curious bond is being blessed at the Church: Montanes and Capitules, lifelong enemies, are now united by the wedding between their first borns. A picture would set the memory fast in their memories, so they never go back to their old quarrels.
16215: The Agricultural Fair is a very special event for farmers, especially this one and her cow! She has asked that you take a picture of the fair for your newspaper.
16216: The firefighters are this farmer's son heroes. Encourage his dream of becoming a part of the squad taking his picture before the firestation.
16217: This farmer is working very hard to provide for her family. Having a fountain nearby would really lift a heavy burden from her shoulders.
16218: Farming tools are dangerous! A few accidents have already stemed from not storing them properly. The farmer would like to have a kiosk to safely put them away.
16219: This farmer's father refuses to retire despite his old age. She has asked that you plant a tree near the field so he can at least get some rest from the sun.
16220: This farmer is terribly committed to her craft and would like to learn more about agriculture in other shores. She has requested you bring bananas from the New World for her and her coleagues to taste.
16221: Farmer would like canned food for her wedding feast.
16222: The farmer is very worried that her family and neighbours do not have enough firewood to last the whole winter. She has asked you for some timber.
16223: Farmer asks for help finding the mysterious man she met in the forest.
16225: A life without worries is starting to get to this worker. He even has a little something for you, who would have said!
16226: The orphans in your town are perfectly healthy and well-fed, they wanted to thank you with a little present.
16227: This worker's coleagues do not take their union meetings as seriously as he does. He would like your help to find them around town and make them attend.
16228: These miners are a close gang, they go everywhere in a line. But not even that prevents them from getting lost in their way to the mines. They'll be in troble if they miss their shift again.
16229: This worker's son is a true revolutionary! So much that he gets his father in trouble. He would like to help to find him and get him to go to bed.
16230: This worker's coleague seems to be causing his union a lot of trouble by revolting on the wrong date. He would like you to find him and disperse his one-man protest discreetly.
16231: This worker has had a very long day and would like to relax at Ah Sing's. He looks a bit disoriented, but you should be able to spot the place easily by the puffs coming out the windows.
16232: Soot and smoke are an essential part of a worker's daily life, but they can always count on Miss Alethea's remedies. Provided they can climb to her house in the mountains...
16240: This worker desperately wants everyone to know about his after-work activities. Unfortunately, the rules explicitly forbid talking about it... but not taking pictures of it.
16241: These brick factory workers are very close pals. They have asked you to take a picture of them as a gift for their friend Jimmy.

16247: The worker would like to organise a barbacue to bring the neighbourhood together. He has requested you provide the sausages and bread.

16320: Jornalero would like you to listen to the story of his life.
16321: This jornalero was taking his usual walk in the mountains when his alpaca found something curious...
16322: This jornalero is very worried about his granchild Miguel, who has not returned home. The last time they saw him, he said he was off to visit his deceased grandmother. Maybe a place of mourning is the best place to start looking.
16323: Jornalero would like to pass on his knowledge to kids.
16324: The alpacas have escaped their pen and now run wild all around town! Help the jornalero gather them back before someone is hurt.
16325: Climate changes have affected the behaviour of the wildlife. This jornalero is very concerned about some crocodiles that lurk not far from the city.
16326: Some sharks are terrorising the pearl divers and making their job more dangerous than it already is. They have asked you to take care of the pest.
16327: Jornalero hope you can give a letter to a woman he once knew.
16328: This jornalero granddaughter helped a criminal, and it would seem like, in exchange, he had a secret for her. It has to do with a grotto in a pirate island. What could it be...?
16329: Your editor wants to feature the hard working jornaleros for the next edition of the newspaper and has asked them to pose for you. Take the snapshot whenever you are ready.
16330: This jornalero would like to have a picture for their family to leave at his altar once he is gone, but he cannot afford a photographer. He has kindly asked you to do it for him.
16331: This jornalero has asked you to take a picture of a sail ship, as it would remind him of his childhood sailing with his father.
16332: The depravity of the newer generations! This jornalero would like you to preserve their traditional principles by building a church.
16333: Pablo's home was burnt in the last fire. His cousin has asked you to build a new house for him and his family.
16334: This jornalero would like to bring his share of happiness to the community by building guitars for everyone. He only needs the wood to make them.
16335: As annoying as playing with his grandchildren might be for this jornalero, he still has a soft side. He would like you to bring him some alpaca wool to make plush toys for all the children in town.
16336: This jornalero would like to cook for the whole neighbourhood as his mother used to do in her memory.
16337: A Jornalero wants to give you a quest.
16338: Rumour has it that there is a child living in the jungle only with a bear and a panther for company. This obrera has asked you to find him and bring him to her so she can take proper care of the child.
16339: An obrera has informed you about a case of police corruption in your town. You should find the crooked officers and end the situation at once. According to what you've heard, they are quite violent.
16340: The jornaleros who work at the corn field are working so hard it is becoming a threat to their health! An obrera is worried about them and has asked you to go there and reassure them that it is not only ok but required that they take a small break every once in a while.
16341: This obrera is very worried about her missing friend. Apparently, she has been kidnapped by La Fortune's pirates. She has asked you to find her at his island.
16342: This obrera is worried about the orphans in the streets. She would like to take care of as many as she can. If you see any homeless children, you can tell them to go to her.
16343: The obreros are so thankful to you for fulfilling their dreams of a better world that they would like to give you a present.
16344: This obrera has a lot of leftovers from her family's gathering and she would like to share it with those who might need it instead of throwing it all away.
16345: This obrera is passionate about knowledge, and she would like you to teach the people overseas about the rich culture of the New World. That's why she wants grant you a relic from her native culture so that you make it part of your museum exhibitions.
16346: This obrera's grandmother passed away and left her a beautiful necklace, but she'd rather you have it and use it to help the poor.
16347: The editor wants to write an article about the one-year anniversary of the success of the obreras revolution, and they have asked that you take the picture for the article.
16348: This obrera believes your town is perfect and deserves the attention of your newspaper. She has suggested you take a picture of the island to appear in the next edition of your newspaper.
16349: Times have fortunately changed, and is completely normal for women to be employed at factories. The obreras are very proud of being part of this shift in society and would love to appear in your newspaper to set an example for future generations.
16351: Many obreros are still fighting for the Revolution against La Corona, but they lack weapons. If you were to send them yourself, they would be intercepted and used against them, but this obrera can use her contacts to make sure they arrive at their destination.
16352: The people of the Revolution are still fighting La Corona's yoke, but they are low on supplies and need your help. This obrera can help bring them bread if you can give it to her.
16353: Even in the tropical weather, nights are very cold in the New World. This obrera cannot forget all the people running away from La Corona and would like to make blankets for them if you give her some alpaca wool.
16354: This obrera believes the community would greatly benefit from having a shared place in which to share knowledge and culture. That's why she has asked you to build a museum on the island!
16355: The obreros have reminded you that democracy demands an appointed institution. That is why they have asked you to build a town hall in the island.
16356: Obrero would like to have a machine used in a factory.
16357: This obrera would love to have a book exhibition at the museum to inspire her love for literature to the community.
16358: The war with La Corona leaves many new refugees every day. This obrera has suggested you build more houses for them to move into your island.
16359: An Obrera wants to give you a quest.
16361: Ask farmers to introduce the artisan to a simpler life
16362: Bring a ship to your main island trading post, and load the Prosperity Contract on it.
16363: Place a Warehouse close to the Court of Justice, and produce the required goods for it.
16364: Bring a ship close to the Queen's flagship that has at least on cargo slot free.
16365: Once your ship gets close to the Queen, accept the message she is sending you.
16366: Take your time to build a large fleet. Consider building Ships of the Line.
16367: Two shipyards working at the same time raise your ship output. The same goes for Weapon Factories.
16368: Don't underestimate the attackers that will come during the escort! Bring military ships that flank the royal supply ship.
16369: You will get important supply when fulfilling this quest. These will help you with the main quest.
16370: Search hooded figures with torches in their hand. Zoom in to see them better.
16371: Don't get into the patrols' sight radius, or else they will attack you.
16372: The smaller and faster the ship you use for this, the higher the success chance. Try it with a Gunboat.
16373: You will get strong military items when fulfilling this quest. These will help you with the main quest.
16374: Ah, the hardships of the lowly life...! I... I don't think I am quite fit for this...! Please, take this for the loss of time.
16375: Artisan would like to give you a gift for your loss of time.
16376: The Queen is determined to end this fighting.
16382: The Royal Supply ship's freight list, to be handed over to the Queen.
16383: Sir Archibald Blake asks if you are ready to receive the Royal Supplies.
16386: Load Settings from file. Changes all settings to the one previously saved.
16387: Save all settings in a file to reuse them for the next game.
16388: Princess Qing is doing her best to mimic the western way of preserving food in cans, but she believes she is not doing something right, for she perceives a metallic taste in the ones her company produces. She has asked you to bring her some of yours in an attempt to figure out what she is doing wrong.
16389: The Princess is terribly curios about the steam carriage. She would like to know more about how it works and has asked you to deliver some to her.
16390: The Princess would like to try using wood veneer to recreate the lacquered boxes from her home, she has asked you to provide it for her.
16391: Princess Qing's best tradeship has already ruined a perfect shipment of porcelain from Madame Kahina's harbour. This time, she has asked you to retrieve it for her.
16392: Qing's father sent her a ship with presents from home, but they never arrived. She has asked you to keep an eye out for them and retrieve whatever you find.
16393: Princess Qing has been working on her poems and wishes to have them read at the Queen's court. She has asked you to bring her manuscript to Sir Archibald and endorse her a little.
16394: The Princess is trying to write a poem about sails in the wind, but she is finding it hard to capture the image without looking at them. She needs you to take a picture she can keep by her desk to find inspiration.
16398: Princess Qing remembers the hope and joy dolphins brought to her heart when she sailed for the Old World. She would like to write a poem about it, but she needs to remember the sight of them with a picture.
16399: The Princess needs help with her next poem. Her source of inspiration, elephants, lay far away from her reach, but you can help her if you take a picture of one.
16400: It seems like Emperor Qing is very interested in the railway system. The Princess has been tasked to write a report about it, but she has asked you to help her describe it with a picture.
16401: The Princess deeply relishes your friendship. She would like to give you a little memento from the East so that you can remember her.
16402: The Princess Qing's sister is paying her a visit and needs to be safely escorted to Qing's island while she's busy preparing everything for her arrival.
16403: Qing's sister is held prisoner by the mysterious attackers. She has asked you to deliver the ransom in gold and get her sister safe back to her.
16404: Qing's sister's kidnappers have refused to release her. There is only one way left to break her free...
16405: Qing's little sister has reached her destination safely thanks to you, and now she feels it is safe for her to visit every corner of the region as long as your warships come along.
16406: The Princess has received a letter from the Emperor telling her that a friend of the family was going to bring her a precious item. She has reasons to believe the situation demands discretion, and has asked you to retrieve it for her instead.
16407: Oh, no, how could this happen...!? The gift, it was stolen from your Queen! If I don't return it immediately with a gift, our diplomatic relationship is forever doomed! My mother's counselor prepared something, but I dare not venture there myself...
16408: Qing was set up and now the Queen demands that she pledges allegiance to her. She has no choice, even if bending the knee is against the Empress wishes, it is what she must do for her father, the Emperor.
16410: The Empress was not happy to hear her daughter bent the knee before a western ruler and has sent a fleet to attack her! Qing has asked you to back her up in battle.
16430: I was elated with your western method of preserving edibles in metal boxes, but I cannot help but taste the tang of brass in the ones we produce... Is there a secret to it that is lost on me? I desire to savour the difference in your canned food.
16431: I am in awe of this horseless carriage. I understand it uses steam to move but... I do not comprehend how exactly it is done! I need to look at it more closely. Will you quench my curiosity?
16432: Where I come from, lacquerware is an exquisite art passed on for generation. I am utterly unfamiliar to this wood veneer of the other New World, but I would love to experiment with this foreign material. Would you be able to provide it?
16433: The brutes I sent to retrieve my last shipment from Madame Kahina's harbour brought nothing but shattered porcelain... Will you be the steady hand to bring me a memento of my childhood...?
16434: Friend, did you notice the terrible storm? My father sent precious presents to ease my homesickness, but I'm afraid they might have been torn from their course in the raging winds...
16435: Dare I dream my words will ever reach the Queen's honourable ears...? You are in good terms with her Sir Archibald, are you not? Could you bring my poems to him and maybe spare a kind word...?
16440: Yesterday night I realised I never properly expressed my gratitude for your friendship. This token brought me many visions of home, I hope it now serves to remind you of me.
16445: My sister is coming to visit! She wanted to contemplate all the marvels I wrote about with her own eyes. I need to prepare for her arrival, will you escort her safely into my longing arms?
16446: I can never repay you for delivering my sister unscathed back to me. She is determined to experience every wonder hidden in this region. I told her many perils lurk beneath the surface, but she feels safe with you...
16447: No... My sister has been taken! I... never should have entrusted you with her precious life... I beseech you, help me mend my reckless actions. This is all the gold I own, exchange it for my sister's freedom and bring her back to me.
16448: Oh, is that all you have...? In that case, terribly sorry, but we do have a much higher bidder on this little princess' life.
16449: Father wrote. A close friend of the family set sail to deliver an important present to me... I am afraid this matter requires maximum discretion. Your ships will raise no suspicion, were you so kind as to retrieve it for me...
16450: The gift Qing asked you to bring her was a treasured belonging of the Queen! The Princess has asked you to deliver it back along with a present from her, as she doesn't dare to go there herself.
16451: Friend! I swear I know not what my mother had me send the Queen! She will forever despise me if I shame the family bending the knee to a foreign queen, but I have no other option! It is my father's will...
16453: Father comforted my doubtful heart, but mother... She has sent imperial warships to clean the stain I put on our family's name! Her shadow already looms on the horizon... Aid me, friend!
16454: Wind-swollen sails are such an inspiring image, are they not? I would like to capture the words of homecoming they whisper in the wind, but I cannot see the docks from my study...
16455: I remember the dolphins passing by our vessel when I first sailed to these lands, lifting every shadow of fear from my heart. Had I but an image of them to help me capture these emotions in a poem...
16456: I envy the wisdom of elephants in these troubled times. Could I capture their mighty essence in ink and paper...? I wonder maybe if a had a picture...
16457: My father has asked me to write a report about the wonders of the western railway system, but I am at a loss of words at its technological wonders. Could you take a picture to ilustrate my report?
16460: No, mei-mei! It... it cannot be... She only wanted to see her big sister's world... I will never be able to look at my father's face again... Our family is forever broken, thanks to you.
16461: I... I am at a loss of words. You do not understand how much you have done for us, for my family. I owe my sister's life to your selfless actions. The Emperor is forever in your debt, dear friend. I am.
16462: My family is forever in your debt, dear friend. My sister will remember the beauty of your home with a sweet smile thanks to your kindness. She gave me this token for you, please accept it.
16463: Hard to believe someone would order theft by mistake, but oh well, at least she had the decency to make up for it with... WHAT!? Archie, what sort of insult is this!? ENOUGH! Qing will come and bow before me herself or I will have her head on a spike!
16467: It is over... It was no doubt the Empress' hand that steered this unfortunate chain of events in an attempt to tarnish father's reputation. I still cannot believe I stood up against her... You truly inspire endless courage, friend.
16468: My mother got what she wanted, the Queen is weaken but I am seen here as a traitor, a paria. I am worthless.
16504: Collect the gift on board a ship at the light house.
16506: To start the expedition, go to the Worldmap and click the Expedition named "The Contract".
16507: Once the Expedition is finished, wait for the ship to return and select the Expedition Ship to collect the reward.
16509: Pick up the item at [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition SpawnContext]) Text]
16512: Don't escort Qing and let her handle the matter alone
16513: Generates Shield on the ship, even during combat.
16515: The requested file has not been found.
16516: A Farmer wants to give you a quest.
16517: Qing has been tasked to deliver a picture of Sir Archibald's island. She has asked you to take it for her.
16518: I do not recognise my father's kindness in these words, but this request for images of Sir Archibald's headquarters does bear his seal... Do you keep your camera still?
16519: Pick up the item at [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
16520: [AssetData([NotificationContext CharacterGUID]) Text] asks if you are ready to give him your cargo.
16521: [AssetData([NotificationContext CharacterGUID]) Text] asks if you are ready to give her your cargo.
16532: Take a picture of a sail ship.
16543: New competitors appear from beyond our borders have us brimming with anticipation. Will they be naughty, will they be nice? Will they bring us fish-tails, bird eggs or mice? Our foreign correspondent digs up more juicy morsels concerning our new neighbours pp.17-18.
16547: Previously uncharted island found! The uninhabited spot is full of promise, say surveyors, who were among the first to wade up the beach this morning alongside excited cartographers, botanists and investors keen to sniff the place out.
16549: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] has discovered a new region overseas, and is already going about the business of gathering the necessary to establish an outpost there. For those wishing to see the world, there has never been such a time as now, apply at once within!
16551: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] discover new clutch of islands close to home, and is rumoured already to be considering investing time and resources there. Keen to seek your fortune in faraway places? Speculative applications welcome!
16553: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] has discovered a new clutch of islands overseas, and is rumoured already to be considering investing time and resources there. Keen to seek your fortune in faraway places? Speculative applications welcome!
16555: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] soaring high, as recently published estimations rank our people more advanced than ever before. "I have faith our governor will sustain this exponential growth", declares monocle-wielder, "we leap like young salmon!"
16557: With recent key advance for our rival, we cast our eyes over the strengths and weaknesses of their company, asking whether they might pose a threat to us. Full and frank analysis pages 3-5.
16559: Our rival is striding away! While we like a spotty bottom are eclipsed! Let us dwell on our inferiority, carefully inspect our failings, and wonder how we might possibly catch them back up before the great race is over!
16564: A lack of manpower is holding back our shipbuilding! There are plenty of jobs to be done down at the dock, but no-one seems suitable or interested enough to take up these positions.
16566: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] spawns merchant navy! Trade must flourish, now this bright and colourful selection are dispatched with their ample tonnages, perhaps to meet with new and exotic trade partners!
16568: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] spawns awe-inspiring naval armada! Of what noble victories and conquests may we now dream?! Let us rejoice, and blissfully ignore any possiblity they may be used to serve unjust causes!
16570: First ever steam vessel christened for [Participants Current Profile CompanyName]! Never more shall bad winds addle our business, or put our navy off their stride! No! Steam, stoked and screw-propellered shall surge us ever more into contention!
16571: Bring 10 more gold to the kidnappers or destroy them
16572: Escort Qing to the Queen island or destroy the Queen blocus
16573: A new island has been discovered.
16576: A competitor has been declared bankrupt.
16577: The transfer of workforce between the islands has been interrupted.
16581: Jean is at a loss of words before some of his enemies. He has asked you for weapons to back up his proposals.
16582: Jean has lost a few too many ships lately and is in need for some materials to build new ones.
16583: Times have changed, and the steam engine has forever reshaped the rules of naval combat. For Jean, you adapt or you die, which is why he has asked for your support in upgrading into steam ships.
16584: Jean has had yet another bad experience with the last people he had to work with: one morning they were gone along with most of his people's supplies. He has been forced to ask for your help.
16585: Jean needs your help keeping a close eye on a shipment that is on its way to his harbour, just in case the Empire tries to keep it from reaching its destination...
16586: Do you dare venture in pirate territory? Jean has officially forwarded you an invitation to come see High Mountain and decide for yourself what you think of their struggle.
16587: La Fortune leaves no one behind. After learning that Eli Bleakworth has one of his crewmembers locked up, he has asked you to sail to Wormways Prison to bail them out whichever way you can.
16588: Eli is willing to let you have Jean's crewmember, as long as you sink the fugitives ship and bring them back to him.
16589: You managed to convince Bleakworth to let you have Jean's mate in exchange for the escaped fugitives. All that's left to do now is crossing the ocean back to High Mountain.
16592: Jean was separated from his parents when he was a child. He has now learned that one of the other slaves managed to escape and is now on Puerto de la Rosa. You might be able to find out more if you ask him.
16593: Etienne had sad news about Jean's mother, but his father was still under the same master when he left. He believes you will find information about him in the slave records, but they are very heavily guarded and sneaking past the patrols will not be easy.
16594: The records seem to indicate Jean's father last owner was William Ward. There are rumours about a slave ship en route near Puerto de la Rosa. Jean has asked you to take a picture of the ship to see if it belongs to Ward.
16595: Whomever is on board of Ward's slave ship is Jean's only lead to find his father. He plans to attack the ship and wants you to fight by his side.
16619: I was schooled in the language of violence the hard way, some understand no other diplomacy than the tip of a cannon. Were you to provide us with... arguments to defend our cause, I'd personally repay you.
16620: Our particular trade depends on ships, as you very well know by now, but we have had a few more casualties than expected lately. I would be in your debt if you could supply materials for our future assets.
16621: Steam vessels lack the elegance of sails, but this game cannot be won unless you adapt fast to the new rules. Bring us what we need to upgrade our fleet and La Fortune's people will remember.
16622: As used as I am to backstabbing by now, it never gets any easier. These... associates of mine ran off with my people's food. I hate to ask but my hands are tied here, I will take any bread you can spare.
16623: I have a very important shipment incoming, but the Empire must not know we are the recipients or they will intercept it. I rest easier if you were to watch over it from under your impartial flag.
16624: You have proven a good friend to me and my people. I believe you will be able to understand what we are doing here. Come visit some time, see for yourself what true freedom looks like.
16628: That weasel Bleakworth has one of my crewmembers locked up on the other side of the world. He has no use for them other than to torment me. I'm not getting anywhere close that imperialist scum's claws, but I'm sure you will find a way to break them free.
16629: Right when I thought you couldn't stoop any lower you come here doing chores for a pirate. But you are right, this worm lets off nothing about Jean. You can have them... Provided you bring these fugitives back to their cells.
16630: Good. These criminals will be punished accordingly... Now take this filth away from my sight. Let Jean enjoy his time with them while he still can...
16631: A man appeared at our shores seeking refuge from a slave owner. He's well protected, but they will not see you coming. Bring him to me, we'll show him what we do to those who like to bargain with human lives...
16633: Mon poteau, may I confide in you...? I still get bad dreams from the days I was a slave. I got sold to another landowner when I was but a child and never saw manman or papa again. I heard uncle Etienne escaped and lives a peaceful life in Puerto de la Rosa, he may know what happened to them...
16634: Jean? Of course I remember the little rascal! I earnt my freedom years ago. His manman sadly passed away, but his papa was still under the same master when I left. They keep the records well guarded, but they will lead you to him if you can get them.
16635: These records... They are outdated, but there is a name: William Ward. I know it is a long shot, but my father might still be with him. I heard rumours of a slave ship near Puerto de la Rosa. If you can take a picture, I can see if it is our man or not.
16636: It is him! They won't take my father away from me again, we strike now! Join me, my friend!
16639: There is word of a slave owner nearby. Jean has asked you to sneak past his security and bring the man to him.
16640: La Fortune's people don't bite, right? I hope you look upon us with kinder eyes now that you understand why we were had to resort to the outlaw ways... Take this, the people gathered it for you.
16691: "The pigs in my zoo have a healthy appetite! I'll need more potatoes to feed them. Let's see, maybe boiled, mashed or in a stew ...?"
16693: "I can't fathom why people think pigs are simple and ugly. They're highly intelligent! But how do I educate my people ... Oh I know! A parade!"
16694: I cannot risk having more steelworks when this island is home to the Ebony Jewelwing, soot would smudge their delicate wings. Don't you produce beams?
16695: "I planned a surprise for the children at the orphanage! When I was young I used to sneak into the kitchen to get chocolate, you know."
16696: "Those hungry, desperate souls on their long voyage ... I couldn't hesitate, I gave them everything I had. Now I need to restock!"
16697: "I need new sails before I can set out! The old ones ... Well, beggars came to me asking for clothes and I had to think quick."
16698: "I cannot abide animals dying for our food. But my polar expedition leaves me no choice ... I shall buy only what we strictly need!"
16699: "All this time I thought shoes made of leather were sad but necessary, when in fact you can use caotchouc! Isn't that amazing?"
16700: There's no way I can look away from the red trail whalers leave behind them...  Quick, sink their ship while I entertain the crew at my harbour!
16702: "Please help us! My expedition hit the cliffs just off the harbour! The crew saved themselves, but not the animals on board!"
16703: "A horrible catastrophe! I just learned a visitor ship has capsized, we have an obligation to help the survivors!"
16704: Poor sailors' superstitions drove them to throw my precious relics overboard. Please retrieve the lost cargo before it's lost forever! I can take any silly curse they bear.
16705: "Visitors are so careless with what they leave behind! The oceans are full of rubbish and it's hurting the wildlife. Let's pick it up together!"
16707: "My advisors are insisting on you as an escort, but why? My expeditions aren't truly dangerous! Oh well, I shall reassure them."
16708: "Cousin Mary cut her visit short after seeing the feline predator enclosures! Maybe she ate something foul ...? Would you bring her home?"
16709: The Pyrphorian arsonist taunts you as you arrest him.
16710: The Pyrphorians won't let go of their evil schemes. More fires are raging in the village, bringing fear and danger. You have to arrest the arsonists to stop this madness.
16711: Hannah is frightened that more Pyrphorian arsonists made it onto your island.
16712: Hannah is relieved you got rid of the arsonists.
16713: You crossed an ocean to save a person you didn't even know! Maybe you are someone I can call friend after all... You have my gratitude, and my people's.
16732: New artillery fortifies [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as Big Bertha fires a salvo to trumpet her own arrival. Sea birds scatter, and rattles clatter. The city has finally grown a spiny husk to protect its silky horse chestnuts.
16734: New depot in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is proof of the city's dynamism. "More storage space you see," says councillor, "bigger is always better."
16736: Pistons have fists pumping in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] as first chugs, pops and squeaks heard behind the Steam Motor workshop door.
16746: One of Da Silva's ship is transporting highly valuable goods. It needs an escort worthy of the name, Da Silva advices you to be prepared.
16747: How nice to have brought your fleet to the edge of the world, the perfect opportunity for Vicente to attack.
16748: Da Silva's nephew is paying him a visit. The seas aren't safe with all these pirates trying to get their hands on blue blood for ransom. Escort Da Silva's nephew to his city.
16749: Da Silva is strongly displeased. No doubt the kidnapper will make themselves known soon.
16750: The kidnapper have reached Da Silva. Staging a meeting during which he will give them gold against his nephew, he sat up a trap for them. Clean up your mess, destroy them.
16751: Da Silva has invited a foreign princess to his city to conclude an alliance. Nobody must know that she comes, overwise their enemy will be at her throat. Escort her, Da Silva's ships would be too suspicious.
16752: Da Silva is bitter, for his enemies to have known that the princess would be escorted by you it means he surely must have a spy in his rank, he will pay for his treachery.
16753: A ship has left Da Silva's island precipitately this morning, Da Silva is sure the spy is on board for he wouldn't want to be caught and face Da Silva's wraith. Destroy the ship and all its crew, no pity for treator and their accomplices.
16754: Are you a lion or a sheep? Prove your worth to Da Silva, destroy Anne Harlow ships.
16755: The little Anne Harlow seems to have some ressources after all, but nothing Da Silva thinks you cannot destroy, right?
16757: Wipe out Anne Harlow, she has been a bug on Da Silva's paw for too long.
16759: Dreadful working conditions persist for Farmers of [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], who have remained chained to the grindstone for this underhand and unprincipled state it seems, forever and a day. We can only hope change will come, and soon! Sign the petition!
16761: Dreadful working conditions persist for Workers of [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], who have held their faces to the furnace for this underhand and unprincipled state it seems, forever and a day. We can only hope change will come, and soon! Sign the petition!
16763: Dreadful working conditions persist for Artisans of [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], who have remained chained to their trestles for this underhand and unprincipled state it seems, forever and a day. We can only hope change will come, and soon! Sign the petition!
16765: Dreadful working conditions persist for Engineers of [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], who have remained fused to their flasks for this underhand and unprincipled state it seems, forever and a day. We can only hope change will come, and soon! Sign the petition!
16769: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] plagued by prospect of bankruptcy! Accounts overdrawn! "A miraculous turnaround" required, according to fickle and useless advisors that likely precipitated the crisis in the first place.
16771: [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] bounces back from bankruptcy! Accounts no longer overdrawn! "A miraculous turnaround!" prate fickle and useless advisors that likely precipitated the crisis in the first place.
16773: Dreadful working conditions persist for Jornaleros of [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], who have run themselves into the ground for this underhand and unprincipled state it seems, forever and a day. We can only hope change will come, and soon! Sign the petition!

16780: My father... was not amongst them. The other slaves knew him, he passed not long ago... It's ok, friend, it was a peaceful death. We returned the ownership of their lives to these men and women. Most of us are former slaves, they will be welcomed in our independent nation. Thank you for bringing me peace, mon poteau, and for reminding me what we fight for.

16816: "'I'll come down on you like a tonne of bricks' he used to say. Well let's see who has the last laugh, now we're all grown up eh?!"
16817: "Alfred and Filbert are a lovely pair of shillings. Now, I couldn't remember if it were ten tonne or twenty owed. But being gents, they were quick to remind me it was thirty."
16818: "My latest trick is called "The Devil's Vessel" a fearful extravaganza of sea-fire! Got a bit hot the first time...'specially for the crew, but its getting there, getting there..."
16819: "'A pocket watch I can guess your card,' is how the trick starts. Shame the cards they keep choosing are the hardest ones to find."
16820: "Asking for gold, I was sure it was the ghost, come for his due. Luckily it's only a brigand, and he gave his word it'd just be this once!"
16821: Lord Flattenflee and I had such a cultured chat, I think he loaded up one too many crates! Haha. I've got loads more, course...but I do need those materials.
16822: "I get through quite a few stage assistants...I mean, you know, they leave. Can't take the city lights, the glamour. P'haps if they looked the part, they'd feel the part?"
16823: "Why'd he have to shout out how its done?! Time that bully Astronomo got a huge kick up the interior - it's what mum wouldda done."
16824: "I'm caught between a frog and a toad! Board want off with a dangerous geezer. I'm like the David to his Goliath, but can I leave all that glory to you?"
16825: Whoopsiedaisies, some crates fell into the ocean when I was moving them on my docks. My mom would always tell me to keep things clean. I don't even recall what's in the boxes, so you can keep them for your efforts.
16826: Magic is truly underappreciated. Was just performing in front of the board during the trip, and out of the blue, one ofthem grabs my entire magic box and throws it overboard. He is lucky I am so calm and let it slide just like that.
16827: I was instructed to not look in these boxes, so I will respect their privacy. I just don't understand why the board wants me to store them, they have warehouses too. I also don't get this whole secret drop off thing, they could just bring them here.
16829: I guess I should have read the contract more carefully before signing it. But you know what, I don't mind having to give my close trading partners a free escort with every purchase they make, they are quite lovely really.
16830: I feel it, he is coming for me, the ghost! I need your help getting back to my harbour. I know what I will do! I will head to the lower deck and think about how to work on my tricks while you be on the lookout for the ghost when he strikes.
16831: Last time my delivery of magic supplies got mysteriously attacked. Who would possibly want to do that? I perform for everyone I know, frequently, without them having to even ask or pay for it!
16832: "Dying prematurely in one's cell is the easy way. Since a fair few of the rotters are on their last legs, I need you to help me feed them back from the brink."
16833: "They nearly clawed their way out last night. Every damn cage needs bolstering, if we are to keep humanity's vermin confined!"
16834: "Stay here too long, go insane. But some arrive mad, and want cells thick enough not all of us have to hear their frenzy."
16835: "Damnation! My gunboat as getaway? By all means use lethal force, but only if absolutely necessary, will you destroy my ship!"
16836: "The woman is a blatant criminal who would be dangling from the gallows, if not for lack of evidence. Yes, I know one when I see one!"
16837: "Release a life-long fraudster just because he has unscrupulous friends on the royal council? Bend the law, and the law bends you!"
16838: "We know the H.M.S Murgatroyd was sunk by a detainee of mine. It disgusts me he is to be released. There must be some evidence against him among the wreckage!"
16839: "Floating bottles may look innocuous to a lay person, but messages inside facilitate a significant number of escapes. They must be collected for me to smash."
16840: "The ship carrying a Category A is overdue. Find it and bring him in. I have the isolation block ready, I'm certain he'll feel right at home."
16841: "My superiors have no idea what it's like out here, deep in the filth. Yet I'm obliged to powder their noses. Can I trust you to preserve their blissful ignorance?"
16842: "Once a criminal, always a criminal. But the occasional snitch gets 'mercy', and the others don't like it. I need you to keep the rats from the cats."

16876: "I am the scrying portal, a mirror to the other realm. But if my legion are to follow me to the kingdom, they must be entranced. + manic description of the liquid"
16877: "I need bricks for a little game. I always reassure my troops beforehand, because they scare. I say, "what doesn't make you stronger, kills you." + throwing of bricks and how it sounds when they hit?"
16878: "Ever consult haruspices? You should. Sadly, I find myself sifting through many animals, before the truth emerges."
16880: "Milk and blood filled the baths of the ancients. I must cleanse myself, for all our sakes, in the uncorrupted essence of animal."
16881: "How can the sordid contraptions of man compare to nature's gifts? If I give my men bicycles, can they escape starving tigers? + You're of course invited! "
16882: "Fishing requires patience. Patience is hard. And when their skinny little mouths won't bite, it hurts.So I detonate them."
16883: "If we are what we eat, I don't think my legion eat right. Bring me texture, bring me body. Bring me something to get their juices flowing..."
16884: "I always asked myself how an antler would look at my wall."
16885: Long-lasting enmity comes to triumphant end after conquest and imprisonment of our Nation's only remaining competitor. Experts guarantee only brilliant prospects now for [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] and our people!
16897: "An infant rabbit flops into peril. Heart tense. Eyes wide, but blind from fear. It runs, you follow. You wring its neck."
16898: "I like exploding things. And this one will surely show some exciting fireworks!"
16899: "How can man be so removed from his ancestors, that he cannot swim? Go! Help natural selection take its course!"
16900: "Rivals to be my mate? Where are their horns, these bulls who do not rut like the beasts they are?! Stab their haunches and passions shall race!"
16901: "Burn me. Each scar the cruel, licentious blister that is man. Drown me. I long to swim up from below, an vision appalling yet pure, like a demon."
16902: "Dolphins cavort behind us, fed fish and lies by my sickening simpletons. False Gods! Smash them, and let the dolphins know freedom!"
16903: "In time, the sea will rise with the smoke. No Atlantis, just man killing man until the oxygen is out. I only keep those who float."
16904: "Swells your spleen, doesn't it? Competition. A powerful armada appears, and you just have to scratch the itch. Snap those buds before they blossom! + Maybe he's offering a bet"
16905: "Their clocks scream in my mind. Foghorns, pigcrap hawkers. Crumple these trader automata, their schedules will shatter my visions no more."
16906: "I heard this expedition returned from asia! So there might be some tiger bones on board! I need them to complete my collection."
16907: "One of royal frigates went aground. I heard, it had some heavy weaponry."
16908: "Humans like to count, it's so reassuring. Do you like to count? Your coins, your friends? Then don't be shy, help me count these bodies."
16909: "The ordinary fascinate me - peeling back their blindfolds, holding them to the light. I tried everything, but I couldn't make the last ones see. Now I need new ones."
16910: "A ship sank in the area. I got a ship ready to bring the castaways to safety, just drop them off in my harbour."
16911: Let's play a game. A visitor ship will pass through the area soon. I will attack it, and you must defend it. I don't see you succeeding, but surprise me!
16912: "I am really bored, so I thought it would be fun to send one of my strongest ships into enemy waters and watch the show. I will hold you responsible if my ship somehow sinks. "

16997: Society of travellers and polymaths gathers in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], who by sharing maps and bulletins, intend to fulfil its ambitious aims before the century is out— "A synthesis of all human knowledge," according to its founder.
16999: There are "invisible rays" all around us, says Dr. Iwa Ebashi The young woman— yes, woman!— is a prodigy they say, in the relatively modern field of physics, and is at great pains to demonstrate her unusual theories in whichever way she is able.
17056: "If every guard had a pocket watch, I would never again feel we are somehow running at the leisurely pace preferred by the ruddy prisoners!"
17057: "It's only a matter of time before the sea is free of pirate-kind. But Her Majesty's mercenaries must have the arms to match them!"
17058: "I never drink, but turnkeys must. Do you have lubricant to keep their keys turning smooth?"
17059: "Holy Bibles in which escape tools have been secreted, are extremely unlikely to pass me by. Pursue the smugglers and burn their sacrilegious stock!"
17060: "You might think we have enough slippery characters, but it's for me to see they clean up their acts. Find the missing surfactants or I'll die of this stench!"
17061: "Three swam for it in the riot. Bring the silly sods back, or they'll drown. They will serve the full sentence!"
17062: "This man is to be taken to place of execution. A kindness if you ask me, but the verdict is apparently contentious."
17064: Rural doctor opposes will of god, jabbing poor passing folk in the arm with sharp needles, for what purpose god only knows! Doctor Jones, a country bumpkin, seems set on giving his patients cowpox on top of their existing smallpox— free of charge, he says—you have to laugh.
17065: RISKING IT ALL FOR A PHOTOGRAPH
17066: Balloonist Mr F.Tourniquet courts disaster as he attempts to snap the city as seen by "wild geese". Photographic chemicals and balloon captaincy threaten to collide in mid-air as Tourniquet leans out for the perfect shot of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName].
17068: The Gurnard line becomes the latest hopeful in ocean and peninsula passenger cruise ships, acquainting its honoured guests (if you don't travel in steerage) with views over strange and distant lands, all while in the lap of comfort and luxury.
17070: Being both a good person, and in a position of responisbility, "is possible", according to acclaimed novelist profiling noted industrialist J.H. Miltwaddle. "Kind, well-bred, with the most charmingly bristly moustache you could imagine on a man," writes Clement Langhorn.
17072: We are pleased to report that a "proclamation of emancipation" takes shape in that constitution across the ocean— a stride towards ending the horrors of slavery forever. Now seemingly absent in our waters, the illegal slave trade sadly continues in some parts of the world.
17073: "I always asked myself how an antler would look at my wall."
17074: "I always asked myself how an antler would look at my wall."
17076: Are you sure you want to destroy all Buildings and Streets on this island?
17078: Change the island layout of your home session.
17084: Transforms litterally your fur factory into a general cloth manufacture, using iron structures and basic wool to produce the best articles.
17085: "Woe is me! Jove and Juno converge upon me! Chandeliers above the audience was a genius idea!...as mum always said try and try again!"
17087: "I may be amazingly powerful, but I'm hardly cruel. Take this darkness off me 'ands, you'll get a reward. Just don't tell the board, alright?"
17088: If you ever want to get business advice from me, I might consider it. Just got a wonderful discount on these goods with minor defects, the supplier just dropped the goods and notified me where, not sure why he didnt just bring them.
17089: Let me tell you about The Amazing Willie. Helped the board without hesitation when they requested help. Problem is that Amazing Willie is now involved in this conflict, and the board won't help me. My ships get constantly attacked.
17090: You could learn from my networking skills. Met this lovely chap, big scar over his eye. He is so kind to offer and pick up the payment he accidentally forgot. He just needs an escort because he apparently has some enemies.
17091: I could swear I had it just a minute ago, where is my wand?! Good thing you are here, I refuse to travel alone without my wand, not as long as the ghost is out there.
17092: "I am terribly excited to surprise Her Majesty on her birthday... the chocolate menagerie is of the utmost secrecy, we cannot have her finding out any of the intricate little details we have planned!"
17093: "Lady Cumbersmythe embarks for the East African uplands, where her researches in cross-cultural musical variations require the distribution of a large volume of Gramophones."
17094: "Her Majesty commissions a munificent banquet for important Antipodeans. We..er.. neglected to factor, the post-prandial cigar posturing, which is so vital to the success of such evenings..."
17095: "A delicate matter. Her Majesty is lately aware of The Movement's ailing cause, and wishes to donate off-the-record. We trust you to keep it all on the quiet."
17096: "I'm an avid wood carver you know. Yes, give me a chisel, a fishtail gouge or a mallet and I am quite content. The things is, I'm so keen, I've run rather short of planks!"
17097: "All the way from the equator, I don't blame them for feeling the chill. Her Majesty will be most vexed if we don't warm them up!"
17098: "Believe it or not, I used to have a wild streak. Wagered a castle against a fellow, and lost! The rashness of youth! Better do the honourable, and build it, hadn't I?!"
17100: "First impressions count! It's unthinkable south sea dignitaries should catch a whiff of piracy during their visit - those bygone days are over!
17101: "Sometimes we are delicate, other times we must pound the cream from the eclair, so to speak. Ma'am's favourites The Movement will suffer if enemy reinforcements reach the colonies!"
17102: "Her Majesty has lost enough, without also losing King Svalbard as a trade partner. The saboteurs of our once-doughty bond must be met head on!"
17103: "You know, the fools stole my least interesting sculptures! Still I'd rather such  naive carvings weren't inflicted upon the general public! + mention that the ships are empty"
17104: "Oh goodness, the treaty cannot be signed unless the storm-wrecked delegation is returned to my harbour and restored with a good dose of smelling salts!"
17105: "Oh, er, this is awkward. We wouldn't normally ask you to wade for flotsam. Trouble is, this particular cargo may or may not connect Her Majesty to Isabel Sarmento!"
17106: "The Maya expedition was a success, but rough seas have deposited one of Her Majesty's treasures en route. She would be most indebted if you could recover it."
17107: "The Duchess of Powys can be quite lemony with me, but perhaps you could whizz by and explain the jolly mix-up - vigilant times, sinking of her barge, etc."
17108: "Her Majesty received an alarming missive over second breakfast. Threats to 'undermine' her authority. Perhaps you could bring the matter to a peaceful climax?"
17109: "The Movement is back - not that, my bowels are fine - I mean the group to whom Her Majesty may well be somewhat sympathetic. Could you ensure their safe passage?"
17110: "Viscount Foxweasel has borne a grudge ever since I smothered him in manure at public school initiation. He plans to sink my exhibition of recent carvings. Can you ensure it arrives intact?"
17111: "They are not traditionally a sailing nation you see, the hill-dwellers. Lost last time, and the time before that. Perhaps you can save us, and guide them in?"
17112: "VIP - Sightseeing Trip Around the world! Show him around will you"
17113:
Archie needs the players help to escort an expedition he is either about to send out, or that is returning.

The expedition was to gather new types of wood he heard awesome rumors about, in an attempt to find the ultimate carving wood.

However, jealous competitors got word of it too, they might want to sabotage. So the player gets asked to help out.
17115: "All who feels abandoned by society always know they can come to me. Those you have nothing left to loose make the best members. I have heard of a group of prisoners who managed to leave jail but we got no news from them since. They may very well be lost at sea. Find them and bring them back to me."
17119: Do they really think they could hide forever? Deserting my crew, becoming my rivals. This won't go unpunished! I trust you have eyes everywhere, find them and send me a picture of their location.
17120: These pirates of the Caribbean certainly must have it much nicer there! No threat of Empire, no grim old world. Still, I am certain I remain the more powerful of the two. Take a picture to confirm it!
17122: If you are a famous smuggler, you are not doing it right. And I am afraid I have become a tad too famous lately. Bring this fragile crate with you, I have promised it to a very looked after friend.
17124: I have full confidence in Mary. While being caught and about to be hanged on the jailor island, she pretended to be pregnant to avoid it. She bought herself a little time, it is our duty to use it to take her out.
17126: Mate, you must know by now but .. I haven't always been a pirate. My father, Benjamin Harlow, was at the royal council but was murdered by the Mad King. An injustice I could never forgive. Blake is pretending to be affected but swear he had nothing to do with it. I will not take his word for it, I want proof. Go to his island and smuggle out all the accounts of the time you can.
17127: I knew it! The documents prove that Blake has done nothing to help my father, inaction is as atrocious as if he had put the rope around his neck himself! But this also proves one thing: Blake was not the only one from the royal council letting my father die. I know have all their names, we will track hem down and kill them all, beginning with William Brawn. His little retirement cruise won't last much longer ...
17128: I know of Christine Purble. While not being part of the royal council anymore, she still feels she can enforce the Empire law on the other side of the world. Destroying her for revenge is fine, but this would also be a huge relief for us, I will help you. I will order my ships to attack as soon as you accept the mission.
17129: You have done wonders. Only one more person is left to strike ... Blake. He never leaves the palace so he will be impossible to strike at sea, however we can definitively make him leave in fear. Friends, let's surround his island, block all communications, destroy his ships! Take this pirate flag, you are truly one of us now.
17130: The Queen will never allow that! And she even has found some unkown pirate to help her! Despite all my sympathy for Anne Harlow's lost I cannot let her put our lives at risk any longer! Anne better prepare for the Queen's revenge.
17131: Friend! Don't abandon us now, I see the Queen ships coming and I fear we won't be numerous enough to face her. Would you stand by my side, one last time?
17136: Great job with Brawn. I hope he had time to see death coming, feeling the fear must have felt on the galore. Our next target might be tougher. Christine Purble has left the royal council years ago to establish herself in the colonies. Ask Jean La Fortune there, as pirate we must stand shoulder to shoulder, he will help. He will be waiting for you next to [Isabel island].
17141: "Oh, er, this is awkward. We wouldn't normally ask you to wade for flotsam. Trouble is, this particular cargo may or may not connect Her Majesty to Isabel Sarmento!"
17143: Are you sure you want to destroy [Popup RefGUID] ships?
17156: "If you think we want courage, sharkbait, i'll dice you. Our bellies are good and full o' fire - drink's just something to do as we watch the world burn!"
17157: "I'm a pirate through-and-through. What keeps us bound is the code! If my lads give life and leg for the fight, only right they get what's shiny."
17158: "If he has one-leg, one-arm, or three of each, don't matter. I polish what I find. That means you too, dogsack! Equip my fresh blood, or suffer."
17159: "Don't think I won't strap fire to my breast and charge your throne rooms, if you don't bring me more of it."
17160: Just received big news from my crew. They managed to steal the ship of someone trusted by the queen. With this, we will be able to get very close to her, I can't risk anything happening to it.
17161: Help anne identify some lazy pirates
17162: "I've got the ear of those on the fence. The pot is stirred. Arm them with yer biggest cannons, and I won't use you as live ammunition."
17163: "I've got the ear of those on the fence. The pot is stirred. Arm them with yer biggest cannons, and I won't use you as live ammunition."
17164: "If you so much as whisper cliché, I'll smash you in the gnarly bits. Get me a proper pirate parrot, or I'll make a brush from yer hair and smoke yer fingers for sausages. + should say something about the kidnapping and that it is as a security measure that he behaves"
17165: "If you so much as whisper cliché, I'll smash you in the gnarly bits. Get me a proper pirate parrot, or I'll make a brush from yer hair and smoke yer fingers for sausages. + should say something about the kidnapping and that it is as a security measure that he behaves"

17167: "We've as much tradition as the crown pimple, or have you never danced the boards with a picaroon? P'haps it's ye who needs to take a walk!?"
